characters: GETTING BACK TOGETHER TO SAVE STUDIO FROM OIL BARRON TEX
MEYER, NORAH JONES, SARAH JESSICA PARKER, HARRISON FORD,
MUPPET TALENT IS I CAN DANCE
STATLER AND WALDORF SITTING IN THEIR USUAL SEATS
FLASH BEAKER AND HONEYDEW QUICKLY WHEEL THE SLOW MOTION
MACHINE ON STAGE RIGHT TO CHEF AND QUICKLY TURN THE DIAL
KERMIT LOOKS TO WALTER, GRATEFUL AND PROUD OF HIS YOUNG
STATLER AND WALDORF IN THE BALCONY
CUT TO FOUR EXTREMELY RICH LOOKING TEENAGERS WALKING THRO
WHAT DO YOU SAY WE PRACTICE THE

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: A series of shots of a pristine, classic American small t Something straight out of Pleasantville. --People walk down the street and say smiling goodmorning they pass each other. --A milkman drops off milk to a white picket fenced house --Children ride their bikes to school -- People exit a bakery with fresh rolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan through a bedroom who’s walls are covered with posters. Muppet posters. Muppet newspaper clippings. A fr photo of a Time magazine cover which features Kermit stan in front of the rest of the Muppets with a headline that reads “Who's the funniest Muppet.” There is also a row of framed photos, the first is of a y boy with a nondescript brown Puppet. We follow the row of photos as the boy grows progressively older, his puppet always by his side, ageless. We reach the last photo of t row and the boy is now thirty, arm around his puppet. We continue to pan and find the man, Gary, laying in bed peacefully asleep, a contented smile on his face. THE ALA GOES OFF. Gary lazily wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Walter! Wake up! Today’s the day we go to Los Angeles!!! We widen to reveal Gary’s brown puppet asleep in a smalle bed next to Gary ala Ernie and Bert.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (waking excitedly) Los Angeles!!! I can’t believe it!! We’re gonna get to go to Muppet Studios right!? You promised!? You weren’t pranking me right!!? If you were pranking me that’s a really mean prank!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) No buddy! I would never prank you like that! You’re my best friend! I know you love the Muppets!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Wooo hooo! Let’s get ready! Los Angeles, here we come!!!! Walter hops out of bed and begins dancing around the room is actually a pretty good dancer, if not a bit spastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary and Walter exit their small but charming house weari matching Powder Blue suits and brown ties which are way t short with knots that are far too large. They each carry suitcase, Walter’s obviously is far smaller.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Alright old buddy, let’s go grab Mary at School and we’re off to Los Angeles!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Los Angeles! The two walk, a spring in their step, literally across th street to a charming and small schoolhouse which reads “SMALLTOWN ELEMENTARY SCHOOL”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary and Walter enter the back of a small classroom where MARY (25) is teaching a class of 3rd Graders.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: So, I hope you all have an amazing spring vacation! Try to study your timetables in between having a whole lotta fun!!! Love you kids! See you in two weeks!! The kids all rise and head out. One by one, they each han Mary an apple until she is left with thirty or so apples. Gary approaches and gives her a small kiss.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Hey, so you all ready for our big vacation?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet! This is the best anniversary present ever! We are gonna have such a great time. I've always dreamt of seeing Los Angeles!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: And the Muppet Studios!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You bet Walter! Now let me grab a sack for these apples and let’s get going! To Los Angeles!!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER/GARY
dialogues.text: To Los Angeles!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, Gary and Mary wait excitedly at the Smalltown bus stop. Mary has her suitcase and a big sack of apples. Aft moment an absolutely pristine, perfectly polished shiny silver old time greyhound bus pulls up with a sign that s “LOS ANGELES” They get on the bus. We watch as the bus pu away, travelling only a few yards before it passes a sign which reads: “NOW LEAVING SMALLTOWN, USA. WE’LL MISS YOU!!!” As they leave Smalltown, USA the population sign drops fr 102 to 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan through the bus. Literally everyone is eating one Mary’s apples. We reach Gary, Mary and Walter towards the back of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I can’t believe it! A tour of the Muppet Studios! Who knows, maybe Kermit will be there!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t get your hopes up Walter. You know the Muppets broke up. I don’t think they use the studios for anything but tours anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that’s just an internet rumor, like Global Warming.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Actually Global Warming is a very real---

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Muppet Studios! I just can’t believe it!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It'll be great. Now if you don’t mind, I think we’re gonna try to get some sleep buddy!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Sure, no problem!

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Walter is sitting next to an old lady who is clearly tryi to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then there was an episode where Gonzo and Fozzie---

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: If you don’t mind, I’m trying to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Walter sits next to a ten year old kid.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: And then one time, Miss Piggy was doing “Pigs in Space” and she---

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: If you don’t mind, I’m trying to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Tight on Walter talking.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: And Rolph, man, Rolph could play piano like nobody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen kid, I’m trying to sleep. Widen to reveal Walter is talking to the bus driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus, which is now a regular, dirty, modern day Greyho pulls up in front of the Mann’s Chinese Theater. The door open and our heroes get off and take in their surrounding awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe it. Los Angeles!!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We're really here!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (really excited) Oh my gosh!! It’s Superman!! A middle aged, unshaven man dressed as Superman approache

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: Want a Picture?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (thrilled) Please!!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Thank you so much!!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (pulling out her camera) I'll take it! She snaps a picture of the three of them.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: Ten bucks.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh...um...I didn’t realize...

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: You already took the picture. Ten bucks, now, or I break your camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto to Gary) Gary, he’s Superman, you better do what he says. Gary hands over ten bucks. Superman walks away.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Just... unbelievable. I can’t believe we met Superman!!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Guys, I don’t think that was the real---

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Superman! Unbelievable! So, when do we go to the Muppet Studios?!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (checking his itinerary) Our tour isn’t for an hour! Let’s check out Los Angeles!! The group cheers! BEGIN CHECKING OUT LOS ANGELES MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC UP
dialogues.text: --- Our heroes go surfing --- Our --- Our --- Our --- Our --- Our --- Our heroes eat at Pink’s Hot dogs heroes take a double decker bus tour heroes go skiing heroes ride a roller coaster heroes eat at Spago heroes watch a movie on the IMAX screen EXT. VENICE BOARDWALK —- CONTINUOUS Our heroes are walking down the boardwalk. Gary checks hi watch.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh! We only have twenty minutes to get to the Muppet Studios! Let’s go check into the motel, unpack our things, wash up, change, and get over there!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes come running up to the Muppet Studios out of breath, showered and changed. Walter is wearing a Kermit shirt. He takes a moment to admire the huge sculpture of Kermit which adorns the studio. He begins to tremble a bi Mary puts her arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Don’t be nervous Walter. It’1ll be great!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (shaking, growing agitated) But..but... What if I get to meet Kermit...and we reunite the gang to put on a show!!! And for a while it seems like I'll be too nervous to perform, but then at the last minute I overcome my fears! And then he asks me be a Muppet...

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry buddy, that’s not gonna happen. I promise. You have nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, Gary, Mary and three or four other really tourist looking visitors are taking a tour of the Muppet Studios, which has now been turned into a Paper Factory. It could be more boring or corporate in appearance.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: So, this used to be the building where all of the costumes were designed. Now its where American Paper Company punches the holes in their three hole punched paper. The tour watches on bored. They walk to the next building TOUR GUIDE (CONT’D) This is where Dr. Bunsen Honeydew and his assistant Beaker developed almost all of their unique and wholly impractical inventions.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Can we go inside!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid not. Now its where trees are turned into mulch and pressed into colored construction paper. It’s filled with toxic chemicals. The tour guide continues walking. He passes a very small bungalow. TOUR GUIDE (CONT’D) And this used to be Kermit’s office, it’s perfectly preserved inside, just as Kermit left it. You really should see it. (beat, then continues walking) Now this next building is where they put the lines on paper to make lined paper. Let’s go inside and take a look. The tour follows, all except for Walter, who lags behind staring at Kermit’s office. He takes a sneaky look to the group, who all look extremely bored, and decides to make move. INT. KERMIT’S OLD OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER Walter opens the door to Kermit’s office. There is dust a cobwebs everywhere, though everything seems to be untouch There are framed photos on the walls of Kermit with all s of celebrities, including one with Jim Henson. He passes a shelf with many award statues: An Emmy, An Os A Grammy, An NAACP Award, A Nobel Prize, An Olympic Medal is in awe, when SUDDENLY THE DOOR BURST OPEN. Walter ducks behind the desk for cover. In walk STATLER a WALDORF, who are giving a tour to a man in a suit anda cowboy hat. This is TEX RICHMAN, and for now, he seems ni enough. He is with several of his “associates,” including unnatractive Bear puppet called Bobo.

dialogues.speaker: STATLER
dialogues.text: This is Kermit’s old office.

dialogues.speaker: WALDORF
dialogues.text: Or so we've been toad. The two share a trademark chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’ve loved the Muppets since I was just a boy. And what better way sirs, to honor the Muppets than to make this beautiful studio a Muppet museum. A shrine if you will. I think I’1l call this room -- The Kermit’s Office Room.

dialogues.speaker: STATLER
dialogues.text: We don’t care what you call it.

dialogues.speaker: WALDORF
dialogues.text: As long as the check clears. Waldorf hands Tex a giant contract.

dialogues.speaker: WALDORF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here’s the Standard Rich and Famous Contract Kermit signed twenty five years ago. This contract is absolutely, positively iron clad. With one exception that shouldn't be an issue for any logical reason, but I should let you know if the Muppets put on a show and get ten million viewers before this contract expires, we can no longer sell Muppet studios to you. The contract expires... (he uses a monocle to read the fine print.) .. in two weeks at which point this property is yours.

dialogues.speaker: STATLER
dialogues.text: If I didn’t know better I’d say you were reciting some sort of important plot point.

dialogues.speaker: WALDORF
dialogues.text: I hope so. Otherwise I just bored the audience half to death.

dialogues.speaker: STATLER
dialogues.text: You mean half the audience is still alive? Statler and Waldorf laugh and exit. IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE DOOR CLOSES, TEX’S TONE SHIFTS. HE SPEAKS MANICALLY TO HI COHORTS.  10.

dialogues.speaker: TEX
dialogues.text: There’s oil under this studio, see!!! I can smell it. I can smell it in my wallet. Sweet sweet oil. In two weeks, we tear this place to the ground and start harvesting the sweet sweet oil under this waste of space. Muppets. (he spits) The Muppets ain’t funny!!! No one is!! Least of all the Muppets! They’ve never made me laugh! Not once. The only way they could save the studio according to this contract is if they get back together and put on a show within the next two weeks that draws in 10 million viewers, but that ain’t gonna happen. No sir. This studio is gone, see. And me, well I’m gonna be even richer than I already am. Maniacal Laugh. Maniacal laugh. Walter listens in shock as Tex’s cohorts begin laughing Maniacally. Oddly Tex Richman just keeps repeating “Mania laugh” as they all exit. Walter rises, looks around nervously, then sprints out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter comes tearing out of the studio, past security, emitting a high pitched and frantic scream. Gary and Mary chase after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire bus stares silently at Walter who continues to out his high pitched scream as he rides. Gary and Mary si beside him, also just staring, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits on the bed continuing to scream. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (to Gary) Gary, you've got to do something.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I’ve tried everything I can think of.  11.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: There’s got to be something. Gary considers.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (to Walter) Sorry buddy. And Gary SLAPS WALTER, sending him flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter runs over and SLAPS GARY sending him flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary, Mary and Walter drive through Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: ...then when he thought he was alone, he said “There's oil under this studio, see! I'm gonna tear it the ground, see? Sweet sweet oil, see!"

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: People still talk like that?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I know, it seemed kind of on the nose. He said the only thing that could stop him would be if the Muppets got back together and put on a show.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: That's impossible. The Muppets broke up. No one can get them back together.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: They're just taking a break! Kermit can get them back together. Kermit can do anything!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but how do we find him? No one’s seen Kermit in years. Not since he retired.  12. They drive past PINK’S HOT DOGS where a man with a STAR M SIGN is set up in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary screeches to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve got an idea!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary, Mary and Walter drive while eating HUGE CHILLI DOGS

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: So how are we gonna find Kermit?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (mouth full) The hot dog guy told me he lives in Malibu. He’s become some sort of a recluse. He never leaves his house, and nobody ever goes in.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: So let’s go to Malibu. We’ll find him, I know we will. To Malibu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes drive slowly through Malibu, crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We've been driving for hours. I think it’s time to call it a day.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (seeing something) Guys?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: We can’t give up Gary. We just can’t. Even if it means searching for days and weeks --

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. It’s too late.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Guys!?  13.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER/GARY
dialogues.text: What? She points out the window. Next to them is a GIGANTIC GRE MANSION WITH KERMIT’S FACE ADORNING THE SECURITY GATES.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You think they know where Kermit is!?!?! Gary and Mary just look at Walter. EXT. KERMIT’S MANSION - LATER Our heroes stand at Kermit’s gates, unsure as how to proc

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: So what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Throw me over.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What if we...

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Walter jumps into Gary’s arms. He balls Walter up and HUR WALTER, but he doesn’t quite make it over the fence. Inst he hits the top and gets ELECTROCUTED.

dialogues.speaker: OH MY GOSH
dialogues.text: The electricity keeps Walter on the gates for an excruciatingly long time, until finally he falls, smoking the ground. Gary rushes to his side. GARY (CONT’D) Walter!!! Walter! Are you okay?!? Walter, delirious, looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (weak) Throw me again.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Guys, I have an idea...  14.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (melodramatic)

dialogues.speaker: THROW ME AGAIN
dialogues.text: Mary RINGS THE DOORBELL.

dialogues.speaker: ARE YOU CRAZY, WOMAN
dialogues.text: They wait in anticipation, finally a voice comes through intercom. IT IS KERMIT THE FROG!!!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Hi ho. A long beat. No one knows what to do. BUZZZZZ. Like a scene from the Wizard of Oz, Gary, Walter Mary stand frozen as the huge gates open to Kermit’s mans After a long beat, Kermit emerges from his front door and walks towards them. He looks the same physically, but he walks very slowly with a cane and wears a Hugh Hefneresqu smoking jacket. As he limps towards them, our group takes what is by any stretch, a sad sight. Kermit is old.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh. He’s... he’s... old. As Kermit walks towards them, Walter begins to cry. Kermi sees this and stops.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Are you crying? No, I was just... He throws down his cane, does a perfect summersault, and begins tap dancing. The gang watches confused.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was just kidding. It’s the whole Willy Wonka thing. I’ve just always wanted to do that. Come on in! INT. KERMIT’S MANSION - LATER Kermit, Gary and an EMBARRASSINGLY STAR STRUCK WALTER sit Kermit’s lavish living room.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I thought you were a recluse?  15.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: No, not at all. I love people. After I retired, that rumor got started and then people just stopped coming by. It gets kind of lonely. I’m actually glad you came by. So, what brings you here?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Well sir, my friend Walter heard some disturbing news today.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: (to Walter) Oh yeah, what’s that? All turn to Walter who just stares at Kermit, trembling.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s the matter, cat got your tongue? Walter NODS vigorously. Kermit BENDS DOWN and grabs his c

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon, Miss Fluffy. This is neither the time nor the place. The cat SPITS OUT a puppet tongue. Kermit hands the tongu to Walter who reattaches it to his mouth. They watch for painfully long beat as Walter starts shaking again, harde and harder. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (terrified) P...PP....PPPPPPP..... Peanut!!! All look at Walter, confused.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: When he’s nervous, peanut’s the only thing he can say.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Peanut! I’m sorry. I’m nervous!!! Peanut!!! (growing more and more agitated) Peanut! Peanut! Peanutpeanutpeanutpeanut! Walter stops to catch his breath.  16.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Oil Barron Tex Richman is gonna tear down the studio to drill for oil!?? And the only thing that’1l save it is if we put on a show that gets ten million viewers within two weeks!?!?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (panting and nodding) Peanut.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Put on a show? I couldn’t do that on my own.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Well, what about the rest of the Muppets?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I haven't been in touch with those guys in years.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You should get them back together!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: It’s easier said than done. Kermit’s face falls.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: SINGS “I MISS THE MUPPETS” SONG. As Kermit sings he walks down a hallway of photos and memories. When he reaches the end of the hallway, he awkwardly turns around and sings about the same memories passed once again, however, this time he sings about how impossible it’ll be to get back together because they all have gripes with each other now.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a song version of this) We would need someone to rally around, someone young and innocent and not specifically any one sort of animal or figure in particular. Someone like...well... (reaching Walter) «you.  17.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (shaking) Me!?! But I’m not a Muppet.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: You could be. You seem a little... Muppety. What’s your talent? Walter starts shaking.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I...I...I don’t even have a talent!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Of course you do. Everyone does. You just have to find it.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: But...I don’t know where to look.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: (smiling sweetly) I don’t know it’s just sort of... in you. Don’t worry, you'll find it. It’s funny, but you sort of remind me of me when I was young. Walter immediately faints.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now where were we? Ah yes, Muppets. Kermit hits a button and his wet bar SPINS AROUND reveali GIANT GREEN BUTTON.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What... is... that?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: It’s the Muppet Emergency Put ona Show Beacon... to be pressed only in case we need to put on a show. I outfitted every Muppet with one of these. Kermit shows our guys his green wristwatch.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As soon as that’s pressed, all the Muppets shall be alerted. Will you do the honors?  18. Walter walks over, lifts the glass shield and very tentatively hits the button. The button lights up BRIGHT GREEN. Suddenly SIRENS DROP DOWN all over Kermit’s house. EXT. KERMIT’S HOUSE Batman-style SPOTLIGHTS with a M SHOOT into the NIGHT SKY INT. KERMIT’S HOUSE Kermit starts RUNNING BACK AND FORTH with his arms in the air, doing a fulls scale MUPPET-PANIC.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Ahhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (panicked) What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: It’s an emergency! We have to panic! After a beat, Gary, Kermit, Mary and Walter all start run back and forth with their arms up. EXT. CAESAR’S PALACE A sign that says “FOZZIE BEAR ROAST.” INT. CAESAR'S PALACE — CONTINUOUS A line of comedians including Bob Saget, Gilbert Gottfrie Jeff Garlin, Cloris Leachman, and Lisa Lampanelli roast Fozzie. Fozzie pulls his hat off and wipes his face with His watch goes off, and he runs offstage in a panic as Li continues, though all of her curse words are Meeped out w an oddly familiar MEEP...

dialogues.speaker: LISA LAMPANELLI
dialogues.text: This guy gets so few laughs he MEEP MEEP. Seriously, his laugh to groan ratio is MEEP MEEP MEEP MEEP. Waka waka? More like MEEP MEEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull out of a television set into a sterile laboratory reveal Bunsen and Beaker watching the Roast as their watc sound the beacon. Reveal it is BEAKER’S MEEP MEEPS which been covering the curse words. Bunsen and Beaker run out the room in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ominous music plays as we pan past a row of nervous looki amateur cooks.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION VO
dialogues.text: In the kingdom of cooking, there can be only one... King of the Kitchen! We see a man in shadows throwing pasta and meatballs everywhere. The figure turns towards us into the light. It’s the Swedish Chef! MOMENTS LATER the Swedish Chef stands before a contestant

dialogues.speaker: HOST
dialogues.text: The Swedish Chef has tasted your flamed grilled salmon. Now let’s see what he has to say. Chef gets in the contestants face and screams ala Gordon Ramsey. The Contestant starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDISH CHEF
dialogues.text: (very angry !) Bork Bork Bork bork bork! The Swedish Chef’s watch starts blinking. He looks at it. SWEDISH CHEF (CONT’D) Holy blorky florky! He panics, throwing his knives up in the air. Assistants camera man scatter as the knives fall and he takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your basic mom and pop Kinkos that’s run by cats. Inside find ROWLF dressed like a cat wearing a Copy Catz smock. CUSTOMER comes up to him. Perhaps the customer is Cat Stevens...  20.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLF
dialogues.text: (really uninterested) Welcome to Copy Catz. Purrfect copies every time. Rowlf curls his paw like a cat. His CAT MANAGER comes out

dialogues.speaker: CAT MANAGER
dialogues.text: What was that, Rowlf? If you want to be a Copy Cat you’ve gotta commit to being a cat! Show him, Precious. REVEAL PRECIOUS, a cat who’s clearly the Cat Manager's favorite.

dialogues.speaker: PRECIOUS
dialogues.text: Welcome to Copy Catz. Purrrrrrfect copies every time. How meeooow help you? Suddenly Rowlf’s wristwatch starts blinking. He turns to Cat Manager and Precious and BARKS AT THEM. They back awa and hiss. Rowlf RUNS OUT of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tight shot of a dark stage where ELECTRIC MAYHEM IS ROC OUT!!! However, ANIMAL IS MISSING. As they jam, they grow more and more excited and begin smashing their instrument ala Pete Townsend. Their song’s cut short when the lights flipped on. The bartender calls out.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Guys, I’m closing up. Nobody's coming. The reverse angle reveals that Electric Mayhem is playing COMPLETELY EMPTY BAR. They start to pack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar door opens and the gang exits into A COMPLETELY FROZEN TUNDRA!! White as far as the eye can see in every direction. They make their way through the snow storm towards their van when their watches start blinking. They PANIC and start running towards the forest. As they run t slowly slow down and freeze until they’re covered in ice.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FLOYD PEPPER
dialogues.text: Whaddya say we panic towards the van?  21. They slowly panic towards the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful Santa Barbara campus for Anger Management. Bi chirp, fountains babble, and people walk around VERY SERENELY. ANGLE ON: A group of eight people sit in a circle on the grass while a MODERATOR with a BLACK EYE runs a group tal Among them are SEAN PENN and ANIMAL.

dialogues.speaker: MODERATOR
dialogues.text: So, Sean, any latent desires to punch people in the face? Sean Penn is chewing on a toothpick, a bit fidgety.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN PENN
dialogues.text: I try to stay away from people and that seems to do the trick. Sean Penn pulls the toothpick from his mouth and gives th Moderator a threatening stare. The Moderator’s scared.

dialogues.speaker: MODERATOR
dialogues.text: Um. Ok. And Animal, how about you? How have you been feeling? Animal just stares at him with no emotion. His watch STAR BLINKING. He looks at it and jumps up, panicking.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN PENN
dialogues.text: No one goes till session is over.

dialogues.speaker: ALEC BALDWIN
dialogues.text: He can go if he wants to. BAAAAAMMMM! PENN DECKS BALDWIN!!! All of a sudden a HUGE FIGHT BREAKS OUT!!! The entire campus ERUPTS in anger and violence. Animal RUNS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spotlight “M” lights up the night sky. A figure, with cape, turns into frame. It’s Gonzo! Except he now has a potbelly and a little bit of gray hair. PULL BACK to reve Christian Bale in full Batman costume standing next to hi

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIAN BALE
dialogues.text: (Batman voice) What are you doing here?  22.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: (imitating his deep voice) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIAN BALE
dialogues.text: Why are you talking like that?

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Why are you talking like that?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIAN BALE
dialogues.text: And who’s that? REVEAL Camilla in a Robin-like outfit.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: This is my sidekick... Chicken. Christian Bale JUMPS off the building and uses his batwin to fly down. Gonzo JUMPS after him. He opens his cape but it does nothing and he PLUMMETS to the ground with a resounding thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room’s filled with green clothes of all kinds. We PAN TO the back where the green wristwatch sits, blinking, unobserved. EXT. KERMIT’S HOUSE All the Muppets are gathered. It’s total chaos as they al greet each other after all these many years. In the background we see Gonzo and Camilla playing tennis. Kermi and Fozzie SEE EACH other.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you called! I thought you were mad at me!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Why would you think that?

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Cause you stopped calling me!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I stopped calling you because you stopped calling me!  23. INT. KERMIT’S MANSION/FOZZIE'S HOUSE - SPLIT SCREEN-

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Kermit in his kitchen next to a phone waiting. Fozzie sit a desk next to a phone, waiting. They both wait for a lon beat. Then, simultaneously, both pick up the phone and di Simultaneously, they both get busy signals. QUICK CUT: Fozzie’s about to ring Kermit’s doorbell. As h hits the buzzer, Kermit flips on a blender to make a smoothie. QUICK CUT: Kermit’s about to knock on Fozzie’s door. Fozzie’s hosting a relay race in his backyard. As Kermit hits the doorbell, Fozzie blows an air horn at the exact moment Kermit knocks. INT. KERMIT’S MANSION

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: I missed you so much!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Me too!!! They hug. Kermit JUMPS on a table and taps a glass.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, everyone. Hello. HELLO

dialogues.speaker: THERE
dialogues.text: Everyone quiets down.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, looks like we got everyone so we can start planning our emergency show.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Well, not everyone.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Nope. I think we’ve got everyone.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLF
dialogues.text: Where’s --

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: All good!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: All done here!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: -- Piggy? Beat. Kermit scrunches up his face.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did I say something wrong? INT. KERMIT’S JET -— CONTINUOUS The gang boards Kermit’s bright green jet. SAM THE EAGLE the captain.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Ohmigoshohmigoshohmygosh it’s Sam the Eagle.

dialogues.speaker: SAM THE EAGLE
dialogues.text: You are stating the obvious, talking brown towel. INT. KERMIT’S JET - MOMENTS LATER Our gang’s all strapped in on the jet.

dialogues.speaker: SAM THE EAGLE
dialogues.text: I’m your Captain, Sam the Eagle. Before we take off, please rise for “God Bless America.” They all unstrap and stand up.

dialogues.speaker: SAM THE EAGLE/GANG
dialogues.text: (singing) God Bless America, Land that I love./Stand beside her, and guide her./Thru the night with a light from above. As they sing, suddenly the plane taxis and takes off. Everyone, including Sam the Eagle in the cockpit, remains standing as they take off. Loose items in the plane, like beverage carts and luggage, fall every which way. INT. KERMIT’S JET - MOMENTS LATER Everyone is sitting in their seats.  25.

dialogues.speaker: SAM THE EAGLE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s going to be a twelve hour flight to Paris, the city known primarily for freedom fries.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: France is pretty far.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Good point. (hitting a button) Sam, let’s travel by map!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam opens a black box to reveal a “travel by map” button. hits it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane goes from the US to France along a dot trail.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Wow, this is much faster.

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Really a lot more economical.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Why don’t we always travel by map?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MISS PIGGY charges into the office. She walks past ANNE HATHAWAY and EMILY BLUNT and SLAMS HER COAT AND BAG on An Hathaway’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE HATHAWAY
dialogues.text: Karl Lagerfeld, Agnes B and Michael Kors are waiting for you -- As she walks into the office --

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Coffee, bagel, donuts, cinnabon, pasta, pizza, omelette station, five minutes ago! Miss Piggy SLAMS the door to her office shut.  26. INT. MISS PIGGY’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS MISS PIGGY holds court before KARL LAGERFIELD, MICHAEL KO and AGNES B. They’re looking at a line of dresses that ar green. Anne and Emily bring in the pile of food Miss Pigg requested, including a chef and omelette station.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: What have I told you?

dialogues.speaker: KARL LAGERFIELD/MICHAEL KORS/AGNES
dialogues.text: You do not like green./No green couture./Pas de vert.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: And yet you still bring me green! Sacre bleu! Throw them in the closet I do not speak of! INT. MISS PIGGY’S GREEN CLOSET Couture is thrown into a closet filled with green clothes We PAN OVER to find the blinking green watch. INT. MISS PIGGY'’S OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Well, what are you waiting for? The dresses to make themselves!? The designers leave. Miss Piggy dramatically collapses on her chaise and looks wistfully out at the Eiffel Tower as eats a cinnabon. Anne pokes her head in.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE HATHAWAY
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle Piggy...I have brought you a list of suitors who would be honored to escort you to the Paris fashion show tonight. It is quite a group. We have, Leonardo DiCaprio--

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Echh. Never. With his solar panels and his Electric Cars. Far too Green!

dialogues.speaker: ANNE HATHAWAY
dialogues.text: Zac Efron--

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: No, too young. FAR too Green for me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth Green?

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: (furious) How many times have I told you!!!! TOO SHORT!!!! Now get out!!! (singing) MISS PIGGY SINGS A SONG CALLED “TI HATE GREEN! I LOVE GREEN!” Suddenly the doors burst open and the gang steps through. The entire gang, with the exception of Kermit. MISS PIGGY (CONT’D) What... who... how... where’s... The gang separates and Kermit walks in. MISS PIGGY (CONT’D) Kermy ! Miss Piggy goes to hug Kermit. MISS PIGGY (CONT’D) No! I promised myself I'd never go back! You must leave! At once!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: (very fast) Alright, we tried. Kermit and all the Muppets start to leave.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Wait! You’re the best Miss Piggy! We need you! The Muppets aren’t anything without your beauty and talent and elegance and ohmigod I’m talking to Miss Piggy Peanutpeanpeanut!

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: (considering) I like you, pashmina with eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (sotto) Nice work.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (sotto) I know my Muppets.  28. EXT. THE PARIS STREETS —- DAY Piggy and Kermit walk along Parisian streets. This should feel like Before Sunset. Sad Woody Allen-esque music play

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: The past is the past. What’s meant to be was meant to be.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Memories are good, but they can also be a prison.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: A prison of our own making. ANGLE ON MISS PIGGY. The movie has become black and white Kermit looks at his black and white body confused. MISS PIGGY (CONT’D) What did I do to scare you away? How I loved you.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I thought you weren't going to get all black and white on me. The movie goes back to color.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: I can’t help it when I’m around you! My dreams are filled with your earless, green head! Miss Piggy goes to kiss him. Then pulls away. MISS PIGGY (CONT’D) When you're young, you believe there'll be many pigs and frogs with whom you connect. Later you realize it only happens a few times. (then, passionate) Why didn’t you come with me to Paris? Just tell me! I can hear it!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Because... the French... eat frog legs!

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Not all of them. A bunch of FRENCH PEOPLE walk out of a restaurant.  29.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH PEOPLE
dialogues.text: (in French) [Those frog legs were delicious/I love frog legs!/I could eat a dozen frog legs a day... oh, wait I do!] They all laugh. PULL BACK TO REVEAL that every restaurant the block they’re standing on is a Frog Legs bistro.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: We’re in the frog legs arrondissement. We shouldn’t have taken our romantic walk in this neighborhood. My bad. (then) If you had just supported me in my career then none of this would have happened!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Look Piggy, this is bigger than just us, it’s about the whole gang! You have to come back with us. The Muppets studio is in trouble and if we don’t put on a show it’s going to be lost forever! Piggy considers.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: I will return for the studio, I will return for the Muppets, but if I return, I will not be returning for you.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: OK, great. Sounds good. Let’s go. Kermit starts walking. INT. KERMIT’S JET The whole gang is now on the jet. Miss Piggy and Kermit a sitting on opposite sides of the jet.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: (dramatically into the middle distance) There is only one way to get to a frog's heart. Jealousy.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Who are you talking to?  30.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Everyone. No one. Myself. NONE

dialogues.speaker: OF YOUR BEESWAX
dialogues.text: Miss Piggy SEES A FREE SEAT next to Gary who sits next to Walter and a sleeping Mary. Miss Piggy sits down next to while looking at Kermit. Miss Piggy starts tickling Gary. Gary starts laughing. Mi Piggy THROWS HER HEAD back in FLIRTATIOUS LAUGHTER. Kermi sees Piggy and Gary laughing together and scrunches up hi face in jealousy.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (half asleep, not opening her eyes) What’s so funny?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (laughing) Just... Miss... Piggy! She was tickling me. Go back to sleep. (whispering to Piggy) Hey, what’s the big idea? Miss Piggy sees that Kermit has vacated his seat.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Mission accomplished. Everyone's talking to each other. Suddenly out from under the chatter, Walter says:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: So, I don’t mean to pry, but I’ve always wondered, why did you all decide to go your separate ways? LONG SILENT BEAT. Rowlf and Fozzie ANGRILY LOCK EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fozzie is doing his routine on stage and people are start to boo. Fozzie continues.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: I went to go see a doctor about why my mood was so erratic. He said I might be Bi-POLAR!! Wakka Wakka Wakka. The crowd boos louder. Rowlf, sitting at his piano sees SWEETUMS REACHING FOR A LEVER BACKSTAGE.  31. Rowlf motions Sweetums to wait. ROWLF BEGINS PLAYING Fozz OFF, A LA A LONG ACADEMY AWARDS SPEECH, and the curtain closes on Fozzie mid performance. Just before the curtain closed we see Fozzie give Rowlf an angry look. BACK TO THE JET: GONZO and CHEF LOCK EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chef is doing his cooking act on the Muppet Show.

dialogues.speaker: CHEF
dialogues.text: Florgy Borgy, Chicken Catchatory! In one hand he holds a very sharp knife and in the other holds up Camilla by the neck who looks terrified. GONZO RUSHES ON STAGE AND TACKLES CHEF! They begin to fight on ground. The audience watches on in shock. BACK TO THE JET: ELECTRIC MAYHEM and KERMIT LOCK EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electric Mayhem is finishing their song and Animal ends w one of his wild drum solos. He gets more and more intense begins eating and bashing his drums to smithereens. The c LOVES it. WE PAN TO BACKSTAGE where Kermit holds a bank statement that says “Drum Budget: $0.00.” Electric Mayhem finishes to a standing ovation and the curtain closes. Ke goes up to Animal. The panting and still agitated Animal bounces over to Kermit.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Animal, listen, we’re running out of money in the drum budget. So I found a place that might be able to help you... calm down. Kermit hands Animal a piece of paper. Animal takes the pi of paper and EATS it. BACK TO THE JET: KERMIT and MISS PIGGY LOCK EYES. INT. KERMIT’S JET - MOMENTS AGO - FLASHBACK Gary and Piggy laugh together. Kermit looks on jealously. BACK TO THE JET: ALL THE MUPPETS and KERMIT LOCK EYES.  32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Muppets are lined up for a photo shoot. Just before t photographer takes a photo, Kermit runs up to him and rai his hand. The photographer snaps the photo. The photo tur into the cover of TIME magazine with a headline that read “Who’s the Best Muppet?” Kermit stands in the foreground raising his hand, while the rest of the Muppets sit in th background. BACK TO THE JET: It’s incredibly silent and awkward. Anim pulls out his flute and plays a brief burst. Then it’s silent again.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (like Woody Allen, pulling an invisible collar) Is it uhhh me or uhhh did it uhhh just get uhhh a little uhhh icy uhh in here? REVEAL that everyone on the plane is frozen because Gonzo opened the door.

dialogues.speaker: SAM THE EAGLE
dialogues.text: Close the door, Gonzo!

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Sorry! I had a great idea for a new stunt. But we’re not high enough. Gonzo closes the plane door. Fozzie turns to Walter.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Like all great comedy teams, eventually, you develop professional rivalries.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLF
dialogues.text: You work together for years and you think you're the best in the group, the most popular.

dialogues.speaker: SAM THE EAGLE
dialogues.text: (sticking his head out) I was the best. But certainly Rowlf was more popular than Fozzie.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLF
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t say that. Although my piano jazz was pretty popular.  33.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: You kidding? I’m funnier than Roberto BEARnini!! Your piano playing was un-BEAR-able! Wakawakawaka!

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: No! They loved me for my beauty and fashionable-ness!

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: You kidding? Me getting hit in the stomach with a cannonball while singing an aria from Carmen is like the most popular thing ever! Suddenly the whole plane explodes in a fight over who was most popular.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Guys, stop fighting! (then) We were all the most popular.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Easy for you to say! You always got all the credit!!! The Muppets all ad-lib agreement.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: (hurt and defensive) That's just... I’ve told you, I never tried to...I can’t help it if... you know what, nevermind. Awkward silence on the plane. The Muppets stare forward n making eye contact. We see why they haven’t kept in touch long and painful silence. WALTER starts singing softly.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (singing) Together again./Gee it's good to be together again./I just can't imagine that you've ever been gone/It's not starting over, it's just going on. The mood softens. Piggy joins in.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Together again./Now we're here and there's no need remembering when.  34.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Cause no feeling feels like that feeling.

dialogues.speaker: ALL THREE
dialogues.text: Together again.

dialogues.speaker: BEAKER
dialogues.text: (to the song) Meep meep meep meep meep! All the Muppets are getting really into the song.

dialogues.speaker: ALL THE MUPPETS
dialogues.text: Cause no feeling feels like that feeling! /Together-a!/Together- a!/Together-a! All the Muppets are going crazy. EXT. KERMIT’S JET The jet is shaking uncontrollably as they all jump up and down with extreme excitement. INT. KERMIT’S JET

dialogues.speaker: ALL THE MUPPETS
dialogues.text: Together again!!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: (TRULY THRILLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LET’S SAVE THE STUDIO!!!!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Yay! And just to be clear we're saving the studio cause we want to! Not cause you told us to.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Well, of course.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m not doing anything for the Man.  35.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I’m not the Man. First of all I’m a frog.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Then like, I’m not doing anything for the Frog.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Down with the Frog! Down with the Frog! Everyone starts fighting again. INT. TEX RICHMAN’S OFFICE - DAY Tex sits behind his desk reading a paper which reads “MUP

dialogues.speaker: GETTING BACK TOGETHER TO SAVE STUDIO FROM OIL BARRON TEX
dialogues.text: RICHMAN’S PLAN TO DRILL FOR OIL.” He pushes the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Bobo, evil cohorts, get in here, Now! Bobo enters with several cohorts.

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: What is it boss?

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Seems some new kids on the block got the Muppets back together today to try to stop me from getting my tasty tasty Texas tea!

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: Tea?

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Oil son! Oil! Tasty tasty oil!! And there ain’t no way some wet behind the ears upstarts nobody’s heard of and a gang of Un-FUNNY, never make people laugh fakers like the Muppets gonna sip up that tasty tea under my watch or my name isn’t Tex Richman!

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: It isn’t?  36.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Of course it is. That’s the point! It is my name, so they ain’t gonna sip my tasty oil! I made a solemn pledge to buy up all the oil in the world and dangonit if I ain’t gonna do it!

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: Out of curiosity, how’d it make the news so fast?

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: PappaRATzi.

dialogues.speaker: THE PAPER
dialogues.text: TEX RICHMAN (CONT’D) (to Bobo) I want you to keep an eye on these un-funny Jokesters. Fuel up my jet. A little taunting from me and those Muppets will run home with their tails between their legs. Some of them literally.

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: Isn't it possible taunting them might only galvanize the group?

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Galvanize!! I told you to stop making up words you dumb Muppet looking moron! Now git! Bobo looks at him a bit hurt. He begins to leave along wi the cohorts. TEX RICHMAN (CONT’D) Ain’t you boys forgetting something? They turn to him confused. TEX RICHMAN (CONT’D) Maniac laugh. Maniacal laugh. Maniacal laugh. They all let out their Maniacal laughs and exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cohorts and Bobo exit and stop laughing.  37.

dialogues.speaker: COHORT
dialogues.text: Bobo, why does he always do that?

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: COHORT
dialogues.text: Say Maniacal laugh? Why doesn’t he just laugh?

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: He can’t. He’s never laughed. Not once. He’s never found anything funny. That’s why he hates the Muppets. If they can’t make him laugh, then no one can.

dialogues.speaker: COHORT 2
dialogues.text: He doesn’t think the Muppets are funny...that’s crazy. TEX RICHMAN’S VOICE COMES OVER THE INTERCOM.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Cohort #2, you're fired. Maniacal laugh. Maniacal laugh. INT. KERMIT’S MANSION - NIGHT The entire ragtag band of heroes sit in Kermit’s living r A long beat as everyone sits in silence, then:

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: (shocked) This is your house!?!?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLF
dialogues.text: Whoa, man!! I thought we split up the dough evenly!!

dialogues.speaker: RIZZO
dialogues.text: Seriously! I share a basement in Chicago with 123 other rats!!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Oh, well, I invested in Apple stock twenty years ago.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: I invested all my money with...BEAR Sterns. Waca Waca! Bad move. Seriously.  38.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: You guys are welcome to stay here whenever you want. I have twenty eight bedrooms.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Like, far out man!

dialogues.speaker: PEPE THE PRAWN
dialogues.text: Far out??? Come on, ok! This is ridiculous, ok!

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Ridiculously far out!

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Well well. I see someone is still celebrating being the best Muppet. REVEAL that on the wall, amidst all of Kermit’s Muppet st is a framed Time cover that reads “Who’s the Best Muppet? Kermit stands in the foreground raising his hand, while t rest of the Muppets sit in the background.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Not this again. Piggy, it’s been ten years, why won’t you let me explain! !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole gang is lined up for the photo shoot.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Alright, on the count of three everyone say delicious flies. One, two... Kermit raises his hand and runs up to the Photographer st with his hand up.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I have to go to the little tadpole’s room really badly. Where is it? The Photographer TAKES the photo.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Down the hall, to the right.  INT. KERMIT’S MANSION And we're back.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: I don’t believe it!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I swear. The Photographer took the photo and used it without my permission. It was a simple miscommunication caused by my tiny amphibian-sized bladder! 39. TIGHT ON MISS PIGGY as we go into QUICK CUTS FLASHBACK -- Miss Piggy and Kermit in a line at the airport. acting really antsy because he has to pee. Kermit is -- Kermit and Miss Piggy are in a theater. Kermit’s openi and closing his legs really fast because he has to pee so badly. -- Miss Piggy and Kermit are at the altar. Kermit holds u his finger and runs behind a bush.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: (defeated) It is true. He does have to pee a lot.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: That was kind of an unnecessarily personal flashback to share, dontcha think?

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Wow, I guess we really should have let you explain sooner!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Sorry to interrupt guys, but if we're going to get a show on tv in time to save the studio, we really gotta shake a leg! (then, confused) What’re you doing? REVEAL all the Muppets are shaking their legs.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean we gotta kick it into high gear!  40. REVEAL Gonzo’s on a motorcycle changing into high gear.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! I’m just saying we’re already playing catch up. REVEAL all the Muppets are holding Ketchup bottles and hitting them with spoons. Mary puts her arm on Kermit’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You talk to them, Kermit. Piggy takes notice of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Eh-hem. Who’s the chick...frog!?!? Gary, who is next to Piggy speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s my girlfriend, Mary. She was on the plane with us. Remember? Piggy eyes her skeptically, then puts her arm around Gary

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Really? Hmm. I never would have guessed her for your type of species. Mary now eyes Piggy, confused and offended.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Mary’s right! Let’s get to the network before we run out of time! ANGLE ON Chef who is holding an empty jar of Thyme.

dialogues.speaker: SWEDISH CHEF
dialogues.text: Too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several quick shots of the Muppets pitching their show.

dialogues.speaker: CBS EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: FOX EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: No. -- A UNIVISION EXECUTIVE.

dialogues.speaker: UNIVISION EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Lo siento, perro no. The Muppets all act really excited.

dialogues.speaker: UNIVISION EXECUTIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That means no. Their smiles fade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit sits across from an ABC executive who looks very uncomfortable. Most likely, this is because ALL OF THE OT MUPPETS ARE ALSO CRAMMED INTO THE ROOM. There is literall SPACE TO MOVE.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: I don’t get it. Why don’t you just keep doing your internet movies?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: What internet movies? The Exec flips on her computer. They see Beaker’s youtube “Ode to Joy.” Beaker guiltily leaves the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Listen Kermit, I like you, and so I’m gonna shoot straight. You guys aren’t famous anymore.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: I wish he’d shot a little more curvy! Waca Waca. The exec looks at Fozzie annoyed and motions to the door.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: The answer is no. Not going to happen. Not today, not tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: So, like, Thursday then?

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Guys...You’re just not cynical enough or violent or ironic enough. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at the shows that are popular today. Robot Wars. CUT TO two COMPUTER-ANIMATED ROBOTS DESTROYING EACH OTHER with a title that comes up that says “Robot Wars.”

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Credit Card Club.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO FOUR EXTREMELY RICH LOOKING TEENAGERS WALKING THRO
dialogues.text: CENTRAL PARK dressed in head to toe designer clothes.

dialogues.speaker: RICH KID
dialogues.text: After the make-out party, you wanna go shopping?

dialogues.speaker: RICH KID 2
dialogues.text: Gucci-tastic!

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: And, of course, the hyper- educational Soyburger and Numbers. A QUICK CUT OF NUMBERS and SOY PRODUCTS floating around a screen as a soothing voice speaks. (Baby Einstein spoof)

dialogues.speaker: SOOTHING VOICE
dialogues.text: How many letters are in the word Harvard? BACK TO THE ABC EXECUTIVE.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but you guys are no longer relevant. Kermit rises to leave and heads for the door. Then he sto and turns back.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Before I go...well, there’s just something I want to say. I think children are smarter and better than all this junk. Sure, they’1l watch that stuff if you don’t offer them anything else, but we have a chance to make this world better and more fun! You’re not going to do that by filling their heads with robots and violence or with rich kids shopping or with boring floating numbers, you’re going to do it by filling their heads with laughter and friendship and hope. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just think... well, I know we're not famous anymore but I want you to know I think you’re making a big mistake. Kermit nods, and reaches for the door handle to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Kermit, wait. (Kermit turns back) You're right.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I am?

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXEC
dialogues.text: Yes. You’re not famous anymore.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: My kids sit in front of the television watching Robot Wars all day, and I wonder why they can’t stop beating each other up. My daughter wants a Louis Vuitton hand bag. She’s three. I hate myself for selling this stuff and, so... I’m going to take a chance and broadcast your show.

dialogues.speaker: MUPPETS
dialogues.text: Yay!

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: I want you to know that if I get fired for this I’m taking you all down with me. (as they’re leaving) I mean it. I go down. You go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit and the Muppets enter the Muppet studios. Walter a Gary look around in amazement. Walter starts shaking uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Peanut! REVEAL that the stage is still there, but quite run down dirty. It’s no matter. Walter is really excited.

dialogues.speaker: PEPE THE PRAWN
dialogues.text: I thought they turned this whole place into a paper factory, ok!?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Everything but the theater.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TEETH
dialogues.text: (sniffing) I’m guessing they couldn’t get rid of the smell. We watch as SHEETS are pulled off the THEATER SEATS and t curtain’s PULLED BACK. The stage is dusted by Beaker. Electric Mayhem PULLS a sheet off their instruments. Anim goes to touch the drums and then BACKS AWAY scared. Gonzo walks into his supply room and PULLS a sheet off his vari stunts. He looks scared to even touch them. Chef walks on his kitchen set and opens the fridge. It’s filled with rotten food. He pulls a flamethrower and BURNS all the fo to a crisp and smiles. He’s back. Miss Piggy walks into h dressing room and uncovers a bunch of paintings and heads that feature her. She then sees a photo of her and Kermit which she tosses in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit stands before all the Muppets.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Alright, guys! It’s time to practice! Let’s start with our opening! Electric Karma starts the Muppet Theme. There are no drum because Animal’s playing the flute. None of the Muppets c keep time as they march in.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLF
dialogues.text: We can’t keep time without drums.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL
dialogues.text: No drums! Sean Penn say no drums for Animal!

dialogues.speaker: SAM THE EAGLE
dialogues.text: I am a fighter, not a dancer.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: And by the way Kermit, why do you always get to open the show!  45.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Because I’m the only one who can fit in the oO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a flashback of the the Muppet Show sign dropping w Fozzie in the “0.” The O breaks off and hangs by one scre It then smashes to the ground. -- Miss Piggy in the “0.” She’s holding on for dear life screaming. -- Sweet Ums in the “0.” Or rather, only the bottom half Sweet Ums. The top half of him is off screen. -- The Muppet Show sign is dropping. There’s no one in th O. Suddenly the O CATCHES FIRE and Gonzo, in a motorcycle FLIES THROUGH THE O. Or rather tries to fly through the O He basically SMASHES right into the 0. He and the rest of the sign catches on fire. Several Muppets put him out wit fire hoses.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Look, guys, let’s not argue. Maybe we're just jumping too far ahead. Let’s see some acts!

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: The Great Gonzo needs a fearless human volunteer willing to risk his life, or at the very least his cognitive capacity. Everyone looks to Gary, the only human. He rises tentativ and Gonzo sits him in a chair and places a pin on his hea Camilla comes out and brings Gonzo a bowling ball.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Oh, wait... NOT THE BOWLING BALL TRICK! No!! Don’t do it Gary!!! He’1l kill you!!! The Muppets all turn and hush Kermit. Walter turns to Ker

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with the bowling ball trick?  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several quick shots of the young Gonzo flinging bowling b at people with pins on their heads and NAILING THEM IN DIFFERENT PARTS OF THE BODY VERY VIOLENTLY, sending them flying off their chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're back. Now Walter looks terrified too. Gonzo begins swinging the bowling ball in a circular motion, ro and round, building anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT/WALTER
dialogues.text: No!!! Please!!! Not again! Somebody stop this madness down from there Gary! nN !li!/Get But it is too late. Gonzo releases the Bowling ball and i flies towards Gary’s head, who closes his eyes in terror. crowd gasps in fear as the bowling ball PERFECTLY KNOCKS PIN OFF Gary’s HEAD! The group erupts in applause.

dialogues.speaker: HE DIT IT
dialogues.text: (to God) THANK YOU!!!! Thank you!!!

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: (with a bow) You're welcome. Donations are gladly accepted. Just drop them in the collection cluckets. A gaggle of CHICKENS walk through the group with buckets some Muppets throw in money. Kermit runs onstage. Kermit looks down at his clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Okay, next. Bunsen and Beaker! Bunsen and Beaker pull back a curtain immediately behind Gonzo where they stand next to a mysterious device.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BUNSEN HONEYDEW
dialogues.text: The Bowling ball act is actually a group routine.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Bunsen don’t---  47.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BUNSEN HONEYDEW
dialogues.text: Allow me to explain. This is my Temporal Displacement Machine. To the casual observer, Gonzo’s stunt looks indeed miraculous. However, it is in fact my device that is truly astonishing.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Dr.! NO! Bunsen flips a screen around on the Machine and replays t stunt for the Muppets.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BUNSEN HONEYDEW
dialogues.text: You see at the moment of release, my faithful assistant Beaker--

dialogues.speaker: BEAKER
dialogues.text: Meep Meep.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BUNSEN HONEYDEW
dialogues.text: (cont. ) --- turns the temporal displacement dial... (pointing to a dial on the device) Slowing time to a near halt... We watch on the screen as everything begins to move incredibly slowly. The bowling ball is clearly going to h Gary in the crotch. We watch as Beaker walks on stage and literally guides the bowling ball directly to the pin on Gary’s head, then casually walk out of frame. DR. BUNSEN HONEYDEW (CONT’D) Time then resumes it’s normal speed and the audience is none the wiser.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: (guiltily) What? I don’t want to kill someone! Again! Kermit looks at the dial.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Wait. The dial here says slow, slower and perfect pasta? Why the perfect pasta setting?

dialogues.speaker: DR. BUNSEN HONEYDEW
dialogues.text: You never know when you might need perfect pasta!  48.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: (to Gonzo) Gonzo, you do stunts! That’s what the people expect. The Muppets aren’t about cheap tricks. We're about actual talent! Now you have to promise if you do this stunt, you won’t be using that freezing time machine. Gonzo nods and skulks off.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, who’s next? MONTAGE OF MUPPETS PERFORMING THEIR ACTS. Everyone is terrible. -- Fozzie Bear does his stand-up act. In the BG, Scooter’ on a pogo stick.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: What’s the bear capital of the world? Koala Lampur! Kermit looks at Rowlf and signals for him to play off Foz Rowlf shakes his head “no.” -- Gonzo destroys another mannequin with his bowling ball -- Camilla leads a bunch of chickens in a synchronized sw They all run into each other. It turns into a chaotic chicken splash fight. In the BG, Rowlf is eating sushi. -- Sam the Eagle has his firework display. He lights it a stands proudly before it. One single sparkler lights up. -- Gonzo destroys a mannequin with his bowling ball. Then accidentally whips another bowling ball behind him, destroying the wall. In the BG, Sweet Ums walks by on his hands. -- Animal’s behind the drum set, still playing flute.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL
dialogues.text: Baby steps!!! Ahhhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit stands on the stage.  49.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Alright, now let’s see Walter's act.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: My... my act?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Yup. Walter begins shaking and then runs offstage.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay...let’s see. Who else is left here? All the Muppets look at Kermit. He realizes he’s the last one to do an act. INT. MISS PIGGY’S DRESSING ROOM There’s a knock at the door. Miss Piggy turns. Kermit pok his head in. He notices a bottle of hair dye labelled: JU FOR PIGS, but looks away respectfully.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Ready to practice our duet?

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: I was ready for the duet of life Frog, but that ship has sailed.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: But Piggy, we have to. The audience expects it.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Oh, Kermy... I might lie to get a job. I might lie to get out of a parking ticket. I might lie to get a free croissant. But I will never ever ever lie on stage. (then, making it up) Besides... I’m already doing a duet ... with Gary. Bring him to me! Miss Piggy turns. Kermit, clearly jealous, leaves the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary watches the acts when Mary walks up smiling.  50.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Hey, Gary, how’s it going?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Couldn't be going better! Angle on Stage: Lou Zealand is hurling fish at Walter who pinned to a target. They barely miss him, sticking like daggers in the target.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Wow, that looks dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: No, Lou is like, an expert.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Look, I don’t mean to be weird but do you think Miss Piggy was a little...

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: A little what?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I don’t know, she didn’t seem to like me very much. Not nearly as much as she liked you at least.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (smiling) Oh my gosh! You're jealous. That’s so cute. Believe me babe, Miss Piggy is just a friend. Kermit walks into the theater and approaches Mary and Gar

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Hey, umm... sorry to interrupt, but Miss Piggy wanted to talk to you about something Gary. She’s in her dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh... ok, I’1l be right back. He kisses Mary on the cheek, and Kermit and Mary look aft him as he goes. Kermit sighs and walks off. Mary watches this concerned. INT. PIGGY’S DRESSING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER A knock. Piggy calls out from behind her dressing screen.  51.

dialogues.speaker: PIGGY
dialogues.text: Entre mon amour, s’il vous please.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (entering) Hi. You wanted to see me? Piggy walks out from behind the screen in a lovely dress.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Could you help me with the zipper? She turns revealing the dress is literally busting open i the back, this zipper is clearly not going up.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh. Wow. Okay. Sure. EXT. PIGGY’S DRESSING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Mary comes walking down the hallway towards the bathroom. However, as she passes Piggy’s dressing room she hears:

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I really don’t think this will work.

dialogues.speaker: PIGGY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We can make it work.

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: But Piggy, I’m only human.

dialogues.speaker: PIGGY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just try!!

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay. I don’t think it’s a good idea, but I’1l try. Mary peeks inside the dressing room and sees GARY trying zip up PIGGY’S DRESS!!!!! Mary looks hurt, and leaves. INT. PIGGY’S DRESSING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Gary is pulling with all his might on the Zipper, and Pig is clearly in a great deal of pain. Gary gives up and let go, and Piggy is able to breath.

dialogues.speaker: PIGGY
dialogues.text: (out of breath) When I find out who shrunk my dress-  52.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I’m sure we can alter it!

dialogues.speaker: PIGGY
dialogues.text: Nonsense! We have to find a new, non shrunken dress!! And you’re coming with me! We must discuss our duet!! Perhaps over a romantic candle lit all you can eat buffet. I’m starving. Go gather your things, I’1l meet you on stage where Kermit can see us.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, what?

dialogues.speaker: PIGGY
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the Muppets are on lunch break. Gary walks up to Walt

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (Walter) Hey bud, you seen Mary?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: She took off. Felt like she was “hogging” all your time.” Gary knows this is odd. As soon as Kermit enters, Piggy t Gary’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Alright, everyone. Let’s practice the opening again. No one is listening to him. Kermit grabs a megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Oh boy. Here we go again!!

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: (eating an Ultimate Baconator Cheeseburger) We're eating.  53.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay, but let’s eat up then, cause we really should get back to work. We don’t have much time.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: You’re not the boss of us!!

dialogues.speaker: ROWLF
dialogues.text: Well, he is the leader.

dialogues.speaker: RIZZO
dialogues.text: Says who?

dialogues.speaker: ROWLF
dialogues.text: It’s just the truth.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Well if that’s the truth, does that mean that I’m a liar! The group erupts into fighting again. A cacophony of argu A second later, TEX RICHMAN WALKS INTO THE THEATER WITH H COHORTS. .

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Maniacal laugh, Maniacal laugh, Maniacal laugh. Lookie what we got here. We got a frog, a pig, a dog. Looks like a good old fashioned Korean BBQ to me. Muppets... (he spits) Can’t even pull it together to unite against a common enemy... me, to save their studio. Pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Now you listen here! We have united! We're just rehearsing our finale!!! The... the... cacophony of the Muppets!!!

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: You can’t fool me... thing. I'ma hunter, and I know when an animal is wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEX RICHMAN (CONT’D) And there ain’t nothin’ you can do now that can stop me from owning this here studio and the tasty tasty texas tea that runs underneath. I’m gonna bathe in this sweet sweet oil until my skin is as leathery as a baseball glove, see. That is, unless you can somehow get ten million viewers for your telethon, which we all know is impossible.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: We will get ten million viewers!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: That’s right! And even if we don’t... even if somehow you do own the studio. It wouldn’t matter. We're friends, and we’ll keep on being the Muppets even if we need to find another place to perform!!!

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: ("don’t make me laugh”) Make me laugh. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FLOYD PEPPER
dialogues.text: I believe the expression is “don’t make me laugh.”

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: I know what I said and I said what I meant. Why would I want you to “don’t make me laugh?” You doin’ that already. You Muppets never made me laugh, so I’m offering you a last chance. Make me laugh, I give you the studio. Long Pause. Finally Fozzie steps up dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: A man walks into the doctors office. Doctor says, “what’s the problem?” Man says, “I have a terrible headache.” Doctor says “Well sir, I think you need to stop picking your nose.” Man says “Why?” Doctor says “Cause I’m trying to examine you.”  55. Long long beat. Everyone waits. Tex Richman snaps his fingers. Bobo produces the standard rich and famous contr

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: This here is the Standard Rich and Famous contract you signed some thirty years ago, you remember? It’s signed right here by one Kermit the Frog!?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Well maybe you shoulda read the fine print. He holds a HUGE magnifying glass to some incredibly small fine print. TEX RICHMAN (CONT’D) See, in three days it’s not just this studio you lose the rights to. It’s the Muppet name itself. And not just that, but ALL characters under the Muppet name. See, I don’t just own the studio. I own... THE MUPPETS. I own the loveable frog, the arrogant pig, the mediocre bear. I own em all!!! So enjoy your last few days together, cause after your failed telethon, you ever want to work together again.... You workin’ for me. Maniacal laugh Maniacal laugh. He and his cohorts exit. Pregnant pause.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER
dialogues.text: Ummm. Kermit. Did he just say that you signed a contract that sold not only the studio but also the rights to the Muppet name and our on-stage personalities which, incidently happen to also be our personal personalities. Kermit gulps. All the Muppets move to pounce on Kermit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit sits in the Witness chair. Our Muppets sit in the box, and Sam the Eagle presides as Judge. Janice and Scoo sit as Prosecution and Defense, and the rest of our Muppe sit in the pews and watch the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I swear, I had no idea. It was thirty years ago! I had never signed a contract before! Janice stands.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: So like...why do I have this like signed contract dating two years before we ever went to Hollywood. Kermit looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: That’s not a contract, that’s a receipt for my Banjo.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: So you say. Like...so you say. The Muppets mumble in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I didn’t have time to read the fine print! And besides, you all wanted me to sign...remember!?!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Muppets stand before Orson Wells.

dialogues.speaker: ORSON WELLS
dialogues.text: Prepare the Standard Rich and Famous contract for Kermit the Frog and Company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit stands over the MASSIVE CONTRACT surrounded by the Muppets. He is glancing through it.  57.

dialogues.speaker: MUPPETS
dialogues.text: Sign it. Sign it. Sign it. Sign ith!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Don’t you think we should read...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Muppets all mumble to each other.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I swear, I would never have done this on purpose. Please, you’ve got to...

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Sustained!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: You’re not supposed to say that. The Muppets consider.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: One final question your honor.

dialogues.speaker: SAM THE EAGLE
dialogues.text: Proceed hippie.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Like, why do you have a courtroom in your house?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: There's fifty rooms in this house, and I ran out of ideas, so I thought... how about a courtroom? Glad it finally came in handy.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: (as though she got him) Like, so you say. I rest my case. The Muppets all mumble to each other. Then, a small voice heard from the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Your fake honor, may I approach the fake bench?  58.

dialogues.speaker: SAM THE EAGLE
dialogues.text: You may, flattened, miniature badger. Walter, who was sitting next to Gary, heads to the front the room and addresses the Muppets.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: When I was just a little brown puppet I felt really all alone. Then I saw my first episode of the Muppet show and even though I didn’t know any of you, I finally had something to hope for. That someday I could be a Muppet. You guys have the power to change people, to give kids hope, but the only way you can do it is if you work together to defeat this Tex Richman guy. Don’t you get it!
