If you don’t, you’ll never get to perform together AGAIN!!! We can’t let that happen. Now I know I’m not one of you, but maybe that’s why I can see it all so clearly. You guys are being stupid! Like really stupid! Like super duper stupid! Now how about we cut it out and put on a show already!!!! Silence. Finally, Janice stands.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Your honor, like, in light of the soggy burnt poptart’s speech... the Muppets would like to like, drop all charges and put on a show. THE WHOLE ROOM ERUPTS IN CHEERS!!!!! THEY RUN OUT. Walter following them.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: You stay here!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Cause if you’re going to join the gang you gotta figure out your act! By tomorrow night! He pats Walter on the back and leaves.  59.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (nervous ) Join the gang?..... Pppppeanut ! He turns to Gary who smiles and gives Walter the thumbs u

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But...but Gary... I don’t have a talent. I’m... totally talentless. Remember when we auditioned for America’s got talent?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Gary, remember... INT. AMERICA’S GOT TALENT - DAY The early auditioning rounds of America’s got Talent. Gar walks out on stage carrying Walter and they approach the

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HASSELHOF
dialogues.text: So, what will you be doing for us today?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Hi. My name is Gary and this is my friend Walter. Walter just stares lifelessly at the panel.

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say hi Walter. (long beat) Walter.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (shaking, whispered) Peanut. Peirs hits his buzzer. So does Hasselhof.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Buddy, please say something. Sharon hits her buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: PEIRS
dialogues.text: Honestly, get off the stage. You are without a doubt the worst Ventriloquist I’ve ever seen.  60.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: No... no I’m not a Ventriloquist. He’s alive, he’s my friend. Sharon rises angrily from her chair.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: We didn’t even get to our song and dance.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's right. That was so bad I completely forgot it happened. Don’t worry. There’s no way something like that could ever happen twice in a row. You’ll find your talent and it’1l be great. Gary exits, and Walter looks mortified. INT. MUPPET STUDIOS/KERMIT’S HOUSE/ LOS ANGELES - MONTAGE A montage of the Muppets each practicing their acts in harmony. They are getting better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary and Piggy rehearse “I’m Your Puppet” on stage. Kermi watches from off stage, jealously. Mary walks in and sees what’s happening. She looks jealous and leaves. INT. ABC PRESIDENT’S OFFICE - DAY It’s a gigantic office, like way, way too big with a gian oil painting of the ABC President right above his desk. T ABC Exec pokes her head in.

dialogues.speaker: ABC PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: What is this about a Muppet show? Nobody's heard from them in years.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: I just thought --  61.

dialogues.speaker: ABC PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: I don’t pay you to think. You're a television executive.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: But if we give them a chance --

dialogues.speaker: ABC PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Fine. But if this doesn’t work out, you’re out on the street, no ifs, ands or buts. (then, friendly, pan to reveal a sundae bar) You want some ice cream? I just got this sundae bar installed to make me more approachable.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: I’m good. The ABC President shoots the ABC Executive a long look.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I would like butter pecan with sprinkles please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit gets a call. In the background we see Beaker spinn plates on sticks. SPLIT SCREEN BETWEEN HIM AND THE ABC EXECUTIVE.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Hey, so I was just checking to see how it’s all going? Beaker has a dozen plates spinning. He puts one final pla on top and the whole thing comes crashing down on him.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: It’s going great! Really great!

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: So, who's going to be hosting?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Iam. Like always.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: That's adorable. No, seriously. Who’s going to host it? We need a celebrity. Pronto. Otherwise I’m getting fired. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And just to reiterate, if I get fired you are all going down with me. I mean it. Get a star. Now. Also, have you booked an audience? INT. TEX RICHMAN’S LOS ANGELES OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Tex Richman and Bobo ride on the top of a double decker t bus through Los Angeles. Bobo wears spy headphones and ho an antenna.

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: They need to find a celebrity to host their show or ABC won't broadcast it!

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Perfect! All we gotta do is run a little interference! They’re gonna have a harder time finding a real celebrity than dancing with the stars!!! EXT. MOVIE PREMIERE AT MANN’S CHINESE - DAY This is a movie premiere for the film “MICHAEL CLAYTON 2: THIS TIME IT’S LESS COMPLICATED AND HAS MORE ACTION.” Geo Clooney poses for paparazzi on the red carpet. Dr. Teeth Electric Mayhem are pretending to be paparazzi and camera

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE CLOONEY
dialogues.text: It was really satisfying to revisit the role of Michael Clayton.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: (posing as a reporter) So, like, is it true that due to your, like, total and complete love of charity you’re going to be hosting the Muppet Benefit?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE CLOONEY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You’re not with Telemundo.

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: (batting her eyes at him) Like, que Senor Clooney? Tex Richman, dressed like an AGENT, whispers something in Clooney’s ear.  63.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE CLOONEY
dialogues.text: No can do. You’re not famous anymore. It’s just not good for my career.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FLOYD PEPPER
dialogues.text: Didn't stop you from doing Leatherheads!! George Clooney whispers something in Tex’s ear.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Security! INT. KERMIT’S MANSION QUICK CUTS of Walter trying to imitate different Muppet talents: Stunts like Gonzo, Piano like Rowlf, a fashion s like Piggy. INT. MR. CHOW’S -— LUNCHTIME Jack Black, Ben Stiller, Mel Brooks and Steve Carell are eating lunch. A plate arrives. The waiter takes the top o the dish revealing Pepe the King Prawn. REVEAL the Waiter Sweetums.

dialogues.speaker: PEPE THE PRAWN
dialogues.text: You guys wanna be in a big Muppet benefit?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE/BEN
dialogues.text: Uh no./Not in a million years. A second plate is put down on the table. Jack lifts the h off. Kermit’s on the second plate.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jack. You seem like someone who loves fun?

dialogues.speaker: JACK BLACK
dialogues.text: I'd do it if you were famous. Or if it would somehow benefit me personally.

dialogues.speaker: MEL BROOKS
dialogues.text: I'll do it. I love a live show.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, mister, but we need big stars.  64. Mel Brooks motions to a waiter, Tex Richman IN DISGUISE a whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I didn’t realize Chinese restaurants had security. A bunch of ninjas drop down and pull them away. INT. KERMIT’S MANSION Walter tries playing saxophone. It sounds awful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah Jessica Parker is changing into couture when Miss P slides in under the door.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Hello lover.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: Tex Richman DRESSED AS SECURITY grabs Piggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon Favreau and Vince Vaughn sit having smoothies. Both a dressed very casually, Jon reads the paper and has a baby a stroller next to him.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE VAUGHN
dialogues.text: I think there’s pineapple in this Super Citrus Blast. I’m just saying, if there’s pineapple, tell a guy. When I think of citrus, pineapple doesn’t immediately jump to mind. RIZZO THE RAT approaches dressed in a very “swingers” bla suit and tie.

dialogues.speaker: RIZZO
dialogues.text: Smoothie, baby. Smoothie. It’s me. Rizzo! C’mon! Rizzo the Rat baby! Remember, Swingers?! I’m just heading to Vegas, baby, yeah.  65.

dialogues.speaker: JON FAVREAU
dialogues.text: I can’t go to Vegas. Swingers was ten vears ago! I’m married now. I’m a director. I have two kids.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE VAUGHN
dialogues.text: I’1ll go to Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: RIZZO
dialogues.text: Vinnie, let me ask you, you wanna host our benefit show on Saturday?

dialogues.speaker: VINCE VAUGHN
dialogues.text: I can’t, I’m gonna be in Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: RIZZO
dialogues.text: C’mon Jonny Boy! What do you say Big Man?

dialogues.speaker: JON FAVREAU
dialogues.text: Did you just call me big man? I’m on a juice diet now!! SECURITY!!!!! REVEAL: Tex Richman making a smoothie. He snaps his finge and JAMBA JUICE security swoop in and tackle Rizzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonzo and Camilla sit in a small Citroen with sunglasses Matt Damon walks out of the office. Gonzo gets out of the car and walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Mr. Damon! Interested in doing a benefit? Matt Damon turns and TAKES OFF. Gonzo gives chase. Damon climbs up a nearby fire escape. Gonzo runs up it to. Suddenly we’re in a full scale Bourne-style movie with cr jump cuts. They get to the roof and start JUMPING from ro top to roof top. Damon, using elegant parkour, jumps down between two buildings and lands on the ground to be confronted by a SCREECHING CAR being driven by Camilla. Damon RUNS OVER the car. Gonzo jumps off the building and SPLATS on the ground. He shakes himself off and gives cha Now suddenly WE’RE IN a Morocco-like place. Damon turns a corner to be confronted by Beaker and Honeydew on motorcycles. They DRIVE UP the stairs. Damon SMASHES through a window and turns to see Gonzo there.

dialogues.speaker: MATT DAMON
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Security.  66. Tex Richman and several guards surround Gonzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooter goes into Copy Katz to pick up the fliers.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER
dialogues.text: Hey, my name’s Scooter. I just came to pick up our fliers. The Copy Katz employee turns around to reveal a DISGUISED Richman.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Here's your sweet, sweet fliers. Meeeow help you with anything else? Maniacal laugh! Scooter looks at him sceptically. Tex HANDS the box to Scooter. Scooter walks off, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooter hands out the fliers to tourists, locals and a gu dressed in the dirty Spiderman costume.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER
dialogues.text: Come to see the Muppets reunited! This Sunday at 7PM! People are taking the fliers. ZOOM IN on the flier. The fliers actually say “Monday at 2AM at the Dubai Internati Convention Center.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary and Gary sit across from each other at a fancy restaurant. Both are dressed up and look great.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You look beautiful. I’m sorry I haven't been around lately but, well, happy anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: To you as well. So...how’s your duet practicing going?  67.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Good...you know. Miss Piggy can be a bit of a handful but we’re getting through it. I sure miss you though, I‘1l tell you that. She smiles and they hold hands. The Maitre ‘D approaches table with a broken arm.

dialogues.speaker: MAITRE DE
dialogues.text: Welcome back, Sir. Out of curiosity, will Miss Piggy be joining you again? I only ask because I don’t want to run out of truffles again.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (caught) No. It’s just the two of us. Actually, it’s our anniversary. He leaves. Mary stares at Gary. GARY (CONT’D) We were just picking up food for everyone. Then Piggy wanted to have some truffles and next thing I knew it was three hours later and the local supply of truffles had run dry.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I don’t know Gary. I didn’t want to do this, especially not on our anniversary but... it just seems like you don’t even think about me anymore. This was supposed to be our anniversary vacation and I feel like I’ve just disappeared for the last thirty minutes of the movie. Gary looks a bit guilty.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I understand. But, I mean...it’s not like I wrote it. Mary looks at Gary, who looks down guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I understand. I just couldn’t have anticipated any of this would happen. But I promise you, you are the number one thing in my life.  68. Tex Richman in disguise approaches holding a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN IN DISGUISE
dialogues.text: Sorry to bother you, but I was hoping I could have your autograph.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Me. Sure, but...why?

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN IN DISGUISE
dialogues.text: You're Miss Piggy’s new man! He plops the tabloid mag down on the table which has a headline - MISS PIGGY’S NEW MAN!!! It has photos of Gary squiring Piggy around town to find a dress.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I can explain! His phone rings. He looks down and sees the caller ID rea LA COUNTY JAIL. He answers. GARY (CONT’D) Hello? PIGGY!?! What are you...you’re where?!?! All of you? Okay I’1l be right down!! Gary hangs up and turns to Mary to explain, only to find SHE IS GONE. She’s left a present. Gary opens it. It’s a framed photo of Mary, Gary and Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan down the hallway of the jail peering through the c where our Muppets sit, dejected. We continue panning unti reach the final cell where CHARLES GRODIN sits, still incarcerated from “The Great Muppet Caper.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guard walks down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON GUARD
dialogues.text: Alright, you're free to go. You've been bailed out. The cell door is opened and our Muppets make their way ou Charles Grodin sees Piggy as she exits.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES GRODIN
dialogues.text: It’s you! Piggy! I never thought I'd see you again!!! Come back! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES GRODIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can still make bacon together!!! It’s fate!!! She sees him and quickly turns to the gang.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Go. Move! Move it along!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES GRODIN
dialogues.text: AT LEAST I’M NOT A RAT!! Rizzo crosses back into frame.

dialogues.speaker: RIZZO
dialogues.text: I resent that! INT. KERMIT’S MANSION - NIGHT Our gang sits around looking to Kermit for inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: So we couldn't get any big stars, what do we do now Kermit?

dialogues.speaker: FOZZY BEAR
dialogues.text: Yeah Kermit! We need an idea fast! Kermit rises. A long beat. He looks like he might cry.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: (sadly) We give up. Everyone gasps in shock.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We tried. We tried everything we could think of. I’m sorry if I let you guys down, but I guess... well I guess this is the end of the Muppets. I love you guys, but I don’t know what else to do. Kermit turns and walks out of the room, beaten. EXT. KERMIT’S MANSION —- CONTINUOUS Kermit walks out onto his patio and gazes out at the full moon sadly. Stars twinkle behind him. From behind, we wat Kermit wipe a tear from his eye.  70. INT. KERMIT’S MANSION - CONTINUOUS Our dejected heroes sit in shock at their leader’s surren A long moment of silence. Finally, Miss Piggy rises and w out the glass doors onto the veranda. EXT. KERMIT’S MANSION —- CONTINUOUS Miss Piggy sees Kermit and walks towards him. She takes a place next to him and the two stand, backs to camera, fra the full moon. They stare at it in silence for a beat, th Miss Piggy turns to Kermit who continues gazing at the sk

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Kermit. I have never seen you like this. It kills me to see you so sad. And do you know why? Because I love you Kermie, not just as a frog, but as a friend. And it’s not just me. It’s all of us. We look up to you. We need you. So don’t give up. Because these past few days. Well they’ve been the best few days we've had since we've been apart. Kermit, you’re the best thing I’ve ever known. Kermit turns to Piggy and the two stand in profile. MUSIC UP: Marvin Gaye’s version of “I’m Your Puppet.” Ker and Piggy gaze into each others eyes. They should kiss. T

dialogues.speaker: SAVE THE STUDIO
dialogues.text: ! WE’VE GOT TO INT. KERMIT’S MANSION - CONTINUOUS Our dejected gang sits in the living room, as Kermit come racing through and heads out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: It’s time to get our big star and save the studio! The gang all cheers and follows. Once the living room is empty, Piggy crosses frame after them, slowly and annoyed  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit, alone, walks tentatively to the front door and ri the bell. Finally, the door opens revealing Jack Black in his pajamas with a Guitar Hero guitar around his neck eat a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: JACK BLACK
dialogues.text: Kermit? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I just wanted to talk to you about the benefit show --

dialogues.speaker: JACK BLACK
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) ---I’m sorry Kermit. I thought we discussed this. And as you can see, I'm kind of busy eating this sandwich. I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: We see that Miss Piggy, dressed like a cat burglar, is standing on the roof of Jack’s house. She leaps off and l on Jack Black, toppling him. ALL OF THE MUPPETS SWOOP IN ROPES, MOTORCYCLES AND JETPACKS, DRESSED IN ALL BLACK, an restrain JACK with ropes and a gag. THIS SHOULD BE AS VIO AS OUR RATING WILL ALLOW!! Piggy leaves the fray and approaches Kermit as the gang subdues Jack. MISS PIGGY (CONT’D) You did it Kermie!!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: No, we...

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Shhhh. MUSIC UP: I’M YOUR PUPPET (MARVIN GAYE) Piggy and Kermit stand face to face, framing the violent kidnapping of Jack Black. A long beat as they stare into other’s eyes. Piggy leans in for a kiss. KERMIT PANICS.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Ummm. .... PEANUT! !!! He joins the fray, leaving Piggy standing alone, puckerin  72.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: (angry) That’s it frog!!! Never again!!!! Never again!!!!! She walks off and spots Gary sitting on the curb looking something. She goes and sits next to him. MISS PIGGY (CONT’D) He makes me so angry sometimes. Gary looks at her sadly, then looks back at the framed ph of Mary in his hands. Miss Piggy takes this in and STEALS without him noticing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is at her desk as her class takes a quiz when an inv is slipped under door. She opens the invite. It reads “Ms Mary Greggs and Her Class Are Invited to see the Muppets Perform as a guest of Gary Stevens.” She opens the door. PIGGY IS STANDING THERE WAITING, DRESSED TO THE NINES.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oh. Hello.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: May I come in?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Um. Alright. Did you just slip this letter under the door?

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Perhaps.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: How did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: I may or may not have borrowed someone's jet without asking.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Kermit?

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Perhaps (she enters) Perhaps. I have come to talk to you about your boyfriend... what’s his name again? Ah yes, that’s it, Carey.  73.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Gary.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Gary. Indeed. Listen Carey, I think there has been a misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Mary.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Piggy. Miss Piggy. And you see Carey, I know that you and Carey have been having some problems. And I know that I may be somewhat at fault for said problems so I just want you to know, I have no interest in Carey whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Gary.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Piggy. Listen dear, I know we got off on the wrong hoof, and I understand your jealousy, I really do, but if you must know, there is only one out there for me...

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Kermit?

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: I can’t say! But what I can say, Carey, is that Carey is a good man, and you must not let my beauty, fame or talent get in the way of the love you share. We are strong women you and I, and women like us must stick together. Perhaps this is best expressed in a female power anthem. Insert “Women in a Man’s world”, a Dolly Parton-esque son between Piggy and Mary as the class watches on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Black, in a tuxedo, is bound and gagged in a chair. Scooter enters enthusiastically.  74.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER
dialogues.text: Five minutes to curtain Mr. Black!!! Jack writhes in his chair and tries to yell through the g SCOOTER (CONT’D) Can I get you anything?!?! (off Jack’s grunts) Sounds great. Good luck out there!!! Scooter exits. INT. WALTER’S DRESSING ROOM - NIGHT Walter’s getting make up done as Gary sits on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: So, are you good to go, buddy? What’s your act gonna be! I’m dying to know!?! Are you excited!?!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Totally. I mean, there’s going to be so many people out there, hundreds of people, but that’1l just make it more fun, right? Right, totally. Walter starts shaking.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Are you shaking?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: No. Just doing a little pre- performance loosening up. Probably should loosen up my teeth as well. Walter's teeth start nervously chattering.

dialogues.speaker: STATLER
dialogues.text: Well someone really cleared the room.

dialogues.speaker: WALDORF
dialogues.text: I wish we'd gotten the message!  75. PULL BACK to reveal there’s no audience. The ABC Executiv walks in and is horrified. She runs backstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ABC Executive walks up to Kermit and Scooter.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: We have a problem. No audience.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Scooter, did you remember to pass out the fliers?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER
dialogues.text: Of course. We gave them all out. Kermit looks at the flier.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: The time of the show... it’s wrong! Dubai!! That’s a totally irrational location for a Muppet Reunion!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick shot of a completely packed stadium in Dubai filled with Middle Eastern Muppet fans. People are getting restl

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: It’ll be OK. We’ll think of something.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Hey, totally cool. Just keep in mind, I go down you go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit stands before all the Muppets.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: So we’ve encountered a tiny little totally not a big deal obstacle which is that we lack an audience. The Muppets get upset, although Walter’s relieved.  76.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Next time try sugarcoating it a little!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: You guys still want to do this?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Putting on a Muppet show isn’t about fame and fortune --

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: Speak for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: It’s about laughter --

dialogues.speaker: ROWLF
dialogues.text: And music --

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: And being beautiful and glamorous --

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: And setting fire to yourself --

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL
dialogues.text: And smashing... flute --

dialogues.speaker: SAM THE EAGLE
dialogues.text: And waving a flag majestically --

dialogues.speaker: DR. BUNSEN HONEYDEW
dialogues.text: And advancing the cause of science -

dialogues.speaker: BEAKER
dialogues.text: Meep meep meep meep meep

dialogues.speaker: SWEDISH CHEF
dialogues.text: And Florgy borg borg --

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: So, what do you say? The Muppets all look to each other considering. Smiles cr onto their faces. Scooter runs in.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER
dialogues.text: Some people just came in! The Muppets POKE their heads out of the curtain to see Ma and her class sitting down. The rest of the audience is empty. Gary’s eyes light up.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooter’s on camera.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER
dialogues.text: And we've got three seconds till we air, and three, two, one -- PAN TO Kermit.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: It’s the Best Muppet Show benefit Ever Made with our special guest, Jack Black! WHIP PAN to Jack Black who’s tied up in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: JACK BLACK
dialogues.text: I’m being held under duress! Please release me! Mary and her class laugh.

dialogues.speaker: JACK BLACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop laughing! I’m not kidding! They've kidnapped me!

dialogues.speaker: STATLER
dialogues.text: The only way you’d get me to watch this junk is if you kidnapped me as well! MUPPET SHOW THEME STARTS PLAYING. The walls of the dark a gloomy basement room fall down revealing a stage. We see shot for shot remake of the classic opening of the Muppet Show, except that Jack Black is tied up in every shot and there is no audience (except for Mary and her class).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter watches the show on his monitor, much more confide now that there’s no audience. Gary, in a tuxedo, checks i

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You feeling a little better?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Yeah. I mean there’s basically no audience. So I am ready to perform.  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit stands center stage.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: And so once this graph -- Dr. Honeydew pulls a curtain revealing a GIANT LIGHT UP G SHAPED LIKE AN OIL FOUNTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- hits ten million viewers we get to keep the studio!!! Mary and her class clap.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right now we're at five hundred viewers. Only 9999500 viewers left to go! And by the way... We have plenty of room here in the audience... (swing to empty audience) .»».so if you wanna come down and see the show live... well, we've got room for you!! Kermit turns to Jack Black.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, Jack Black, are you excited or what?

dialogues.speaker: WALDORF
dialogues.text: Or what! Waldorf and Statler laugh.

dialogues.speaker: JACK BLACK
dialogues.text: Please somebody, anybody call the police! This is real rope! I’m really tied up here! Mary and her class laugh at his antics. INT. TEX RICHMAN’S SUPER HIGH TECH NERVE CENTER - NIGHT Tex Richman and his underlings sit before a bank of monit The graph of viewers watching the Muppet show is very low  79.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Five hundred viewers?! If it stays that low, they won’t air but five minutes. Turns out America don’t care about talking felt! Bobo looks hurt.

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: Well, I’m technically talking felt.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Did I hurt feelings? Sorrry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonzo walks on. A background drops that says in giant letters THE AMAZING GONZO.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Prepare yourselves, ladies and germs, for Gonzo’s most amazing feat next. Head bowling! REVEAL that Jack has a pin on his head and Gonzo’s holdin bowling ball.

dialogues.speaker: JACK BLACK
dialogues.text: I have not signed off on this!

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Drumroll please! SFX: Animal plays the flute.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And a one! And a two! And a... Gonzo spins the bowling ball around and around.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... three! Jack flinches as Gonzo tries to let the bowling ball go. His arm is now spinning wildly around and around in a cir Jack flinches. He remains flinched and then opens his eye

dialogues.speaker: GONZO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My fingers got stuck. One sec.

dialogues.speaker: JACK BLACK
dialogues.text: Please make this end! Please!  80.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Here we go! Jack flinches. Gonzo’s arm continues to spin in circles.

dialogues.speaker: GONZO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: False alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family stares bored at “Soyburger and Numbers.” The Mot starts channel surfing. She hits the Muppets. The LITTLE GIRL starts laughing joyfully at the antics. INT. TEX RICHMAN’S SUPER HIGH TECH NERVE CENTER The graph of viewers watching the Muppet show moves up.

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: Sir, we have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Just a commercial break. Nothing to worry about. INT. GEORGE CLOONEY’S MOD HOUSE - DAY George Clooney is watching television on an enormous flat screen and flipping through the channels. He lands on Gon spinning the bowling ball as Jack Black flinches. The ent audience laughs hysterically. George Clooney laughs and t looks angry. George Clooney picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE CLOONEY
dialogues.text: Why am I not a part of the Greatest Muppet Benefit Ever? Jack Black is killing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People stream into the audience, filling it up. INT. WALTER’S DRESSING ROOM - NIGHT Gary pokes his head in. Walter could not be more relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Great news! The theater’s packed!  81. Walter instantly starts shaking, turns to Gary.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Oh. Great. You know, if you wouldn't mind, I think I just need a second alone? Just to get excited.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Of course, buddy. Everything will be great! And just so you know... I’m nervous too.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Who said anything about being nervous? Walter tries in vain not to shake again. Gary smiles reassuringly and heads out. Walter starts to hyperventila Walter starts running around his dressing room in spazzy circles, dashes to the window, and crashes through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonzo continues to spin his arm in a circle.

dialogues.speaker: JACK BLACK
dialogues.text: Just make it end already! The audience laughs. Kermit steps in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: We'll get to see what happens with Head Bowling later in the show! And now FOZZIE BEAR! !!! Jack and Gonzo get rolled off stage, Gonzo’s arm still spinning, Jack still flinching. Fozzie comes onstage.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE
dialogues.text: So glad to see you all made it, especially with the traffic being so bad. You know what I do to get through traffic? Grin and bear it. No one laughs except for the ABC Executive who’s having a oddly great time. ANGLE ON Kermit getting nervous. He and Rowlf see Sweetums heading for the mysterious lever. He l to Rowlf at the piano and gives him a nod to play him off but again, Rowlf refuses. George Clooney suddenly walks p Kermit and onto the stage.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it me or is it getting hot in here? Wish I could take off my coat! Waca waca! George Clooney heads onstage behind Fozzie. The audience cheers and laughs. Fozzie smiles, thinking his joke worke out. Then he turns.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: George Clooney! Oh my goodness! You made it!!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE CLOONEY
dialogues.text: Just Bear-ily. Traffic was grizzly! Waca Waca Waca!! The crowd erupts in laughter.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, I just did almost the same joke! You’11 laugh at his puns but not mine!?!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE CLOONEY
dialogues.text: I'm a big star Fozzie, they’1l laugh at anything I do.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE
dialogues.text: Not Leatherheads. The crowd erupts in laughter, the ABC Exec chief among th

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE CLOONEY
dialogues.text: Geez, will you lay off Leatherheads already?!

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE
dialogues.text: What? You should be happy. That’s the biggest laugh that movie ever got! The crowd goes nuts. CUT TO A GRID OF CELEBRITIES in their various houses watc their television, including CHRIS ROCK, MARTIN SHORT, JON

dialogues.speaker: MEYER, NORAH JONES, SARAH JESSICA PARKER, HARRISON FORD,
dialogues.text: STILLER and really whoever we think we can get, picking u their phones and calling their agents.  83.

dialogues.speaker: CELEBRITIES
dialogues.text: Clooney's killing!/Why am I not on this thing?/I want in!/I'm twice the talent of Clooney! He’s just a pretty face! PAN DOWN A ROW OF HOUSES IN THE SUBURBS AS WE SEE televis flipping to the Muppet Show Benefit. INT. TEX RICHMAN’S SUPER HIGH TECH NERVE CENTER The graph of viewers watching the Muppet Show goes higher

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: What? People are actually watching this. That can’t be. (then, epiphany) I got it! Bobo! Check to see if I own the network!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GONZO is surrounded by Dr. Honeydew, Kermit, the ABC Executive and SEVERAL MUPPET DOCTORS who are trying to de the bowling ball from his rapidly spinning arm. He KNOCKS few of the doctors away. Jack is still tied up in his cha flinching.

dialogues.speaker: JACK BLACK
dialogues.text: Could you at least move me away from the trajectory of the bowling ball? Please? ANGLE ON THE CAMERAS as the camera men shut them down. Kermit runs up to them.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERAMAN
dialogues.text: The owner of the network, Tex Richman, wants us to shut down. Sorry. Let’s go, boys. The cameramen leave. The ABC Executive runs on.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Not to fear! I am personally turning them back on.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: But if you go down --  84.

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: -- then at least I’ll have seen a great show. Several Muppets run to the cameras and FLIP THEM BACK ON.

dialogues.speaker: PEPE THE PRAWN
dialogues.text: Do you know how to work one of these things?

dialogues.speaker: ABC EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: I don’t know how to make television. I’m just a TV executive, but we'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit REAPPEARS on the television. The camera work is terrible. Half Kermit’s head is off screen.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Sorry about that little technical difficulty! Now let’s give a round of applause for Dr. Teeth and Electric Mayhem!!! INT. TEX RICHMAN’S SUPER HIGH TECH NERVE CENTER Tex Richman and Bobo are in the nerve center.

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: They're back on the air! And as hilarious as ever! Tex shoots Bobo a look. BOBO (CONT’D) I mean, and as annoying and terrible as ever.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Only one thing to do now. Tex PULLS OUT wire cutters. TEX RICHMAN (CONT’D) Get up on the roof and shut them down. Time to mothball these felt- brained morons. Bobo looks upset. They LEAVE the high tech nerve center  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and we reveal the high tech nerve center somehow fits inside an OSCAR MEYER WEINER MOBILE that’s parked right outside the Muppet Studios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get up to the giant antennae. Tex takes his giant wi cutters out and raises them like he’s making a toast.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: To the end of Puppets, Muppets and Marionettes and to the sipping of tasty tasty Texas teal!!! Bobo grabs the wire cutters and tosses them away. TEX RICHMAN (CONT’D) What’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: Enough is enough, Tex.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Enough is never enough, see!? And don’t forget about the tea! The delectable black tea!

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: It is true, Tex. I do love oil. But I am a Muppet in my heart. And I promise, you'll always remember how this “felt!”

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: BOBO
dialogues.text: It’s a pun! Bobo HITS Tex off the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band is about to play when JON MEYER, BRUCE SPRINGSTE and NORAH JONES join them.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN
dialogues.text: Would you mind very much if we joined you?  86.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TEETH
dialogues.text: If you have to. Animal, you sure you don’t want to play drums?

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL
dialogues.text: Can’t... touch... drums. Drums Bad! Flute good!

dialogues.speaker: DR. TEETH
dialogues.text: They're here if you want ‘em. (to Bruce, Jon and Norah) Just follow my lead. Keep the vocals tight and splashy. Anda one, two, three go!!! They start playing. INSERT SONG HERE BETWEEN JON MEYER, BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN AND NORAH JONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fozzie comes up to Rowlf, still a tiny bit defensive.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Well. You didn’t have to play me off this time! Rowlf walks over to the mysterious lever back stage.

dialogues.speaker: ROWLF
dialogues.text: I would never do anything to hurt you old friend. That’s why I played you off that day. This lever opens a trap door to a shark tank. The network made us put it in back in the day for acts that weren’t working.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: What? A shark tank? I don’t believe you! Fozzie hastily pulls the lever.

dialogues.speaker: INTO A SHARK TANK
dialogues.text: Fozzie looks to Rowlf gratefully. With screaming in the background, they hug.  87.

dialogues.speaker: NORAH JONES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ohmigod! Bruce is literally riding a shark! He can do anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter runs in a blind panic.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Abhhhh! He stops, out of breath, then starts running again.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ahhhh!

dialogues.speaker: ACTS
dialogues.text: CHINESE CHICKEN BALLET - Camilla, a bunch of chickens and Barysnikov dance in traditional Chinese costumes. HOMEMADE SALSA - The Swedish Chef dumps tomatoes, onion a hot peppers onto the floor. Then he and Rachel Ray do a sultry salsa dance over the ingredients. DINNER THEATER - The curtain rises to reveal a beautifull set table filled with FOOD MUPPETS (a Muppet bread loaf, Muppet roast with eyes, a Muppet basket of vegetables.) T begin performing Romeo and Juliet. ARNOLD SCHWARZENHEIFER AND HIS OPERATIC MUSSELS - The cur rises to reveal a pig dressed like Arnold Schwarzenegger Terminator-style black leather jacket. He starts to sing aria. He PULLS OFF his jacket to reveal he’s covered in MUPPET MUSSELS, as in the shellfish. They all join in on aria. ANGLE ON THE GRAPH: Muppet viewers go up and up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary runs up to Mary and her class.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What’re you doing out here? Don’t you still have to perform?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I wanted to thank you for coming.  88.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Miss Piggy invited me. She explained everything. And then we sang about how hard it is to be a woman in a man’s world. It was really inspiring.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: And I love you. Mary and Gary kiss. ANGLE ON THE CURTAIN: Kermit, peering from behind the curtain, sees them kissing and realizes Gary’s not dating Piggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kermit looks from Mary and Gary kissing to Piggy who star dramatically at a beautiful sunset and ocean vista as a w gently blows her hair. Kermit NERVOUSLY GOES over to her. REVEAL that she’s standing in front of an ocean vista set that a fan is pointed her way.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Listen Piggy. I’ve been doing some thinking.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Caw Caw. REVEAL Fozzie standing there. Kermit and Piggy turn to hi

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: A seagull. To increase the romantic atmosphere. Kermit and Piggy stare at him until he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: And, well... I was just wondering if maybe, you might want to...  89.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: I won’t sing our duet. I just can’t bare the heartache any longer.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: (returning) I can bear it! Waca Waca

dialogues.speaker: JOKE
dialogues.text: Fozzie leaves again.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: It’s not about the duet. I’ve missed all of you so much. But the person I missed the most is you. I’d rather be legless than not be with you.

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: You’1l move to Paris? Kermit nods. PIGGY LEAPS UP EXCITEDLY!!! MISS PIGGY (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: OH KERMIE
dialogues.text: Music up: Opening strains of I’m Your Puppet. They gaze i each other's eyes. Kermit leans in and kisses Miss Piggy the music begins to swell. Kermit extends his hand. Piggy throws off her rope revealing the most beautiful gown a p has ever worn. She takes his hand. They walk a few steps hand in hand. Then: MISS PIGGY (CONT’D) (screaming) SORRY GARY! I’M DOING MY DUET WITH

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: She smiles at Kermit and they walk out of frame together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtain opens. Kermit’s in a tux on a crescent moon p with Miss Piggy in a chiffon bridal gown. The band starts playing, Animal still not at the drums. Miss Piggy and Kermit sing “I’M YOUR PUPPET.” The graph SPIKES TO 9.5 MILLION VIEWERS!!! The audience claps. Gary and Mary watc on smiling.  90.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I should go check on Walter! He’s up next! They peck and he heads backstage. INT. WALTER’S DRESSING ROOM Gary opens the door. Walter’s gone, the window broken.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Oh no. Kermit arrives, excited.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Alright!!! It’s time for the big closer, is he ready?? Kermit sees the broken window and SCREAMS!!!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: He must have gotten stage fright!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: (to Gary) We've got to find him! Let’s split up! Go! GO! (Gary exits, then to Scooter) Find someone to fill! We’ve almost made it!!!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTER
dialogues.text: But sir, we’re running out of stars! We’re really scraping the bottom of the barrel now!!!! ANGLE ON BILL HADER about to go onstage.

dialogues.speaker: BILL HADER
dialogues.text: I heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stops running and stops in front of an electronics store with several televisions in the window playing the Muppet Benefit Show.

dialogues.speaker: GARY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’re you doing, Walter?  gl. Walter turns to find Gary running up to him.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: How did you find me?

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: This is where people always go when they’re running away from a personal challenge. See? REVEAL that there’s a woman dressed as the witch from Wic Conan O’Brien and a guy in a Jack in the Box uniform.

dialogues.speaker: WITCH FROM WICKED
dialogues.text: (talking to herself) What if I forget all the lyrics? What then! ? CONAN O’BRIEN (talking to himself) I just don’t know if I can do another show tonight and keep up the quality!

dialogues.speaker: JACK IN THE BOX GUY
dialogues.text: (talking to himself) What if I can’t master how to make the BBQ Bacon Sirloin burger?! BACK TO WALTER.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I don’t have an act! I can only go out there if you go with me!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Are you sure? I mean this is your big chance... WALTER JUMPS ONTO GARY’S ARM AND SLAPS HIM.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I can’t handle the pressure!!!!! I can only do it if you’re there with me!!! Please!!!!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Anything you need buddy. You still remember our routine?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I’m pretty sure. Let’s go!  92. Gary and Walter turn, revealing that the Muppet Studios a right behind them.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It felt like I ran way farther. They run into the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooter’s off stage, panicked. Fozzie on stage looks to Scooter and gestures “What now?” Scooter looks around concerned, sees Chef walking by, grabs him and pushes him onstage.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: And now, for an encore, the Swedish Chef! Chef walks on stage tentatively, no act prepared. THE GRA IS HOLDING STEADY AT 9.5 MILLION. No phones ring. Chef lo around the stage. There’s no cooking equipment set up. He stands there silently. The audience grows impatient. Angle on: Backstage the Muppets look around nervously. IN

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE ON STAGE RIGHT TO CHEF AND QUICKLY TURN THE DIAL
dialogues.text: “PASTA.” DELICIOUS SPAGHETTI AND MEATBALLS FLY EVERYWHERE AND CHEF GOES NUTS.

dialogues.speaker: FLURGY BURGY BURGY
dialogues.text: The audience applauds. More silence. THE GRAPH HAS NOT

dialogues.speaker: MOVED. THEN
dialogues.text: NODS TO FOZZIE! Fozzie quickly runs to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Now get ready for the biggest event of the night, Gary and our newest Muppet, Walter!!!!! Fozzie claps and walks offstage leaving Gary holding Walt like a puppet, like the act they did at the beginning of movie in Venice. They’re both in tuxes. The band begins playing.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: We're friends...  93.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Oh yes we're friends...

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Until the end...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: The very end...

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: And nothing, no sir, nothing... Without warning, Gary TOSSES Walter off his hand and onto stage! IN SLOW MOTION, Walter flies through the air and gives Gary a “what are you doing” look. Walter lands, lim on the stage. The audience lets out a SHOCKED GASP! A lon silent moment. GARY (CONT’D) (sotto to Walter) C'mon, Walt. You can do it. This is your big chance, I’m not letting you pass it up. Long beat. Then Walter sits up.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Can tear us apart!!! Walter begins tap dancing... INCREDIBLY WELL. The audienc applauds loudly.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m a dancer! That’s it!!! MY

dialogues.speaker: MUPPET TALENT IS I CAN DANCE
dialogues.text: Gary smiles and slowly takes a step back to give Walter center stage. Walter is a brilliant and diverse dancer. H does ballet, then capoeira, then a somersault and a cartwheel. The audience is going nuts. As his dance solo comes to an end, Walter does a standing backflip and land flawlessly RIGHT ON GARY’S HAND! It should look like a mi Cirque de Soleil, Stomp and Crouching Tiger, Hidden Drago

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No nothing! Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Can tear!

dialogues.speaker: GARY /WALTER
dialogues.text: Apart!i!!t! Gary tosses Walter up into a triple flip which really jus looks like someone threw a puppet up into the air. He dro onto the ground on his feet. THE CROWD GOES NUTS! Phone’s are ringing off the hook! The graph spikes to 9.9 Million viewers. The crowd rises to its feet in anticipation as t graph ticks closer to 10 million. Muppets run on stage exuberantly and hug Walter and Gary and each other. Gonzo bowling ball still spinning in his arm dances around the stage. Suddenly the lights go out and house lights come o Tex Richman HAS APPEARED on stage. He pulls a GIANT RIFLE OUT and points it at Kermit and Miss Piggy. THE GRAPH ABRUPTLY STOPS AT 9,999,999.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: I tried to negotiate. I tried to talk reason. But no, you all had to put on a show and make America fall in love with you all over again. Well how’s this for a show, America?

dialogues.speaker: GONZO
dialogues.text: Somebody arrest him! He’s got a gun!

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: I’m aiming at a pig and a frog! What they gonna get me for, hunting without a license?! Just as Tex is about to pull the trigger the movie FREEZE DR. HONEYDEW appears.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HONEYDEW
dialogues.text: We here at Muppet Labs are aware that puppetry is not the most advanced form of entertainment. His assistants PULL the Temporal Displace Machine on scre

dialogues.speaker: DR. HONEYDEW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Therefore we now present to you the top secret fourth setting of the Temporal Displacement Machine dial. Dr. Honeydew flips the dial PAST PASTA to “Bullet-Point-o View-O-Matic.”  95.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HONEYDEW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bullet-Point-of-View-O-Matic. Once the fake Texan pulls the trigger, we will go into an exciting computer animated point of view of a slo mo bullet, thus bringing you the cutting edge of visual stimuli! BACK TO THE ACTION.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: If I don’t get my oil, then no one does. Dr. Honeydew FLIPS ON THE DEVICE and then GOES OFFSCREEN. Tex Richman PULLS THE TRIGGER. We go to BULLET POINT OF V ie. We’re looking down the shaft of the rifle at Kermit a Miss Piggy. Everyone is now moving in slo-mo. The gun fires! And the bullet emerges... as a puppet bullet at th end of a stick with whooshing bullet noises made by the Muppet who’s holding the stick. The Muppets are moving in slomo, but it should be clear that they’re pretending to in slomo. Fozzie walks in.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE
dialogues.text: What’s going on guys?

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Ixnay ormalnay eedspay!

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE
dialogues.text: Oh, slo mo bullet pov! Sorry! Fozzie goes into slo mo as well, blinking. He follows the bullet with his eyes, like a bad actor, mouth open, eyes super wide. The bullet continues on its trajectory toward Kermit and Miss Piggy. Tex is smiling evil-y when Gonzo’s bowling ball suddenly FLIES OFF HIS FINGERS and BLOCKS th bullet! We RESUME NORMAL SPEED!

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: What! No! Tex pumps his gun and is about to fire again when Piggy KARATE CHOPS it out of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: ENOUGH OF YOU, MISTER
dialogues.text: The audience cheers. But the graph does not move.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: What’s happening, why did the graph stop?  96.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Looks like you’ve run out of viewers- and luck!! And just in time. He motions to a clock on the graph as it ticks to midnigh series of sad buzzer sounds go off and the graph flashes

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: YEEEEE-HAAAAWWWWWWWWWW. The studio is mine see!!!! It’s mine!!!! And so are the Muppets!!! You gaggle of misfits will never make anyone not laugh ever again!!!!! The crowd and the Muppets are in stunned silence. Angle o Statler and Waldorf.

dialogues.speaker: STATLER
dialogues.text: Waldorf, I don’t know what to say. I feel... sad.

dialogues.speaker: WALDORF
dialogues.text: I don’t get it?

dialogues.speaker: STATLER
dialogues.text: It’s not a sardonic joke, it’s the truth.

dialogues.speaker: WALDORF
dialogues.text: Oh. Ummm. I guess I do to. Waldorf begins to cry, followed by Statler. The audience begins to cry. A series of quick shots of home viewers also crying. All of our celebrities back stage are crying. On stage, all of the Muppets begin to cry and comfort eac other. Tex watches on pleased. Fozzie, determined, steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: (holding back tears) Everyone stop crying! Don’t give him the satisfaction! This isn’t over!  97.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Oh it’s as over as Barney the Dinosaur. Nothing you can do. The Muppets are done for good!!

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: You might own the studio, and you might own the Muppets, but you don’t own our friendship and as long as we got that... well we’1ll figure something out. I promise you, this ain’t over! You messed with the wrong bear! So don’t you worry Tex Richman, I guarantee “oil” be seeing you very soon!! Long beat as Tex Richman stares at Fozzie. Something begi to happen to his face. He looks pained. It takes a long t but finally a strange sound emerges from Tex... a laugh. grows and he begins laughing hard.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: (laughing) “Oil” be seeing you. I get it. Because it sounds like “I'll be seeing you”, but instead you said “Oil”, because of my obsessive, almost cartoonish love of Oil! I get it!!!! I'm laughing!!!! I'M LAUGHING!!!! HAHAHAHAH!! “OIL!I!!!1”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tex falls to his knees crying he is laughing so hard. Everyone watches on confused. TEX RICHMAN (CONT’D) (through tears and laughter) You made me laugh!!! Finally!! Thank you!!! Keep it!!! You can keep the studio!!! It’s yours!! Just keep making me laugh!!!

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Are you kidding, we're a “barrel” of laughs. Tex immediately stops laughing and glares at Fozzie.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A barrel!? Like a barrel of oil? Tex thinks, then shakes his head no.  98.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Do the other one again.

dialogues.speaker: FOZZIE BEAR
dialogues.text: Oil be seeing you later? Tex starts laughing hard again.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: Yes!!! That’s the one!!! HAHAHAHA. It’s yours, the studio is yours!!

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: We did it, Kermy! We did it!

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: We did do it. And we did it together!!! WE’RE BACK!! (to the Muppets) And if it’s okay with you guys. (to the audience) And if it’s okay with all of you, well, we want to bring back The Muppet Show! I want to do this every week! With more acts, and more laughter and more fun! What do you say!?! All the Muppets and the crowd erupts in cheers. Miss Pigg and Kermit hug. The Muppets go into a FINAL GIANT MUSICAL

dialogues.speaker: MUPPETS
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: BE TOGETHER AGAIN
dialogues.text: The music ends. Except for the drums. ANGLE ON ANIMAL who is playing the drums. MUPPETS (CONT’D) (singing) Together again! Animal won't stop playing the drums. MUPPETS (CONT’D) (singing) Ain't it good to be...! Animal still won’t stop playing.  99.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: I think we’re done here, Animal.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TEETH
dialogues.text: Don’t touch him. He’s working something out.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL
dialogues.text: Ah! Ahhhh! Drums taking hold!!!! Animal's going crazy on the drums. Animal pounds on the drums so hard he starts to bash his way through the drums into the ground. He’s digging a hole with the drums.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Someone stop him! Mortar and bricks fly out of the hole as Animal digs hims deeper and deeper. Then silence...

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL
dialogues.text: Uh oh. There’s an UNEARTHLY SHAKING and suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: oil. Animal SHOOTS OUT OF THE WHOLE on a FOUNTAIN OF OIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fountain of oil SHOOTS THROUGH THE ROOF, Animal ridin the top of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Muppets running this way and that. Oil fountains star BURSTING through the floorboards. Chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In our one or maybe two CGI shots in the entire film, we a wide shot of Los Angeles, oil fountains exploding ridiculously high into the air under the Muppet Studio.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang celebrate under the sweet, sweet oil.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE CLOONEY
dialogues.text: I loved that whole kidnapping bit. How'd you think of it?

dialogues.speaker: JACK BLACK
dialogues.text: That was no bit. I was kidnapped. I was scared for my life.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE CLOONEY
dialogues.text: (laughing) You are a crack up. You and your family should come out to Lake Como. We'll drink Chianti on jet skis. WE PAN to Tex Richman in HANDCUFFS. A BUSINESSMAN comes u to him.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: I represent the shareholders of Richman Oil. You are hereby relieved of your duties as CEO.

dialogues.speaker: TEX RICHMAN
dialogues.text: What? Why? All I live for is tasty, tasty oil!

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: Because instead of doing the work that being a CEO of a global multinational corporation requires, you spent all your time in disguise trying to get the oil that’s under the Muppet studios. You realize there’s only like twenty barrels down there? As he says that the oil fountain immediately DRIES UP.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good day, Tex. ANGLE ON Walter, Gary, Piggy and Kermit.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Terrific dancing, Walter. One of the best Muppet performances I’ve ever seen!! We’d be really happy if you wanted to join us on the Muppet Show!  101. Beat...

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Peaaaaaaaaaaaaa...almond!

dialogues.speaker: MISS PIGGY
dialogues.text: At least he’s moved onto a different kind of nut. Kermit and Miss Piggy head off. Mary shows up.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Amazing, guys. Really amazing.

dialogues.speaker: GARY /WALTER
dialogues.text: It was all him./It was all him.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Walter, I have a friend I’d like to introduce you to. We met in the ladies room. She couldn’t stop talking about your act. From behind Mary steps a PINK REPLICA of Walter.

dialogues.speaker: PENELOPE
dialogues.text: Hi. I’m Penelope.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Pleasure to meet you. I’m Walter.

dialogues.speaker: PENELOPE
dialogues.text: (shaking) PPPPPP...Penelope! I’m a big fan. PPPPPP....Penelope!! Against the full moon, Gary and Mary kiss. We PAN past th to Kermit and Miss Piggy kissing, to Gonzo and Camilla th Chicken kissing to the Swedish Chef and Rachel Ray kissin A photographer runs in front of all the Muppets. We recog him as the same photographer who took the fated “TIME” picture years ago.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Kermit! A picture! Kermit shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: KERMIT
dialogues.text: Sorry sir. Not this time. Not without my friends. The Muppets all look to each other and smile. They gather put their arms around each other.  102.

dialogues.speaker: RIZZO
dialogues.text: (as he bites into some) Say CHEESE!!!!! Flash. Our gang, together, smiling. PAPER UP: THE MUPPETS

dialogues.speaker: ARE BACK
dialogues.text: Back to live: The Muppets hug and celebrate. We pull up f final crane shot when the MAHNA MAHNA CREATURE jumps into frame and we pull back to closeup.

dialogues.speaker: MAHNA MAHNA
dialogues.text: Manamana! The TWO SNOWTHS pop into frame.

dialogues.speaker: SNOWTHS
dialogues.text: Doo doo da da da!

dialogues.speaker: MAHNA MAHNA
dialogues.text: Manamana!

dialogues.speaker: SNOWTHS
dialogues.text: Doo doo doo doo! We close with A MONTAGE OF EVERYONE in the film, Muppets, actors, celebrities, crew, etc. singing Manamana with Mah Mahna. FADE OUT.
